Character Creation

Main
Home
Character
Gear
Reference
Worldbuilding
Almanac
Monsters
Spellcasting

How to Make a Character

  1. Choose a Class: Begin by selecting a class that will define your character's core abilities.
  2. Select a Path & Talents of your Class: Refine your character's abilities and potential growth with a path and associated talents.
  3. Class Path Progression: Reflects the overall growth in a character's chosen class. It's linear and sequential, with each step unlocking new class-specific abilities. At 1, 3, 6, and 9 gain +3 points to put into your checks to a maximum of 15.
  4. Talent Progression: Focuses on specialized skills or unique capabilities within a class. Steps within a Talent can be chosen and advanced in any order, allowing for customization and you gain +1 per talent chosen.
  5. Determine species: Choose a species type for your character and apply the corresponding features to your sheet.
  6. Fill Out Checks (Stats): Finalize your character's stats, ensuring you've covered all essential attributes.
    • You have 20 points to put into your checks with a maximum of 10.
    • It's recommended that you put a 10, 5, 3, and 2 with some slight variations.
  7. Roll or Pick from each of these tables:
    • Motivation: Determine their main goals.
    • Additional Equipment: A pack of equipment.
    • Trinket: Trinkets are a fun item that can spark ideas and backstory about your character.
  8. Personalize Your Character:
    • Name: Reflect your character's spirit.
    • Size: Default is medium, but your species options may specify height.
    • Gender: Define your character's pronouns.
    • Age: Decide if they're young or old.
    • Diet: Define their eating habits.
    • Speed: Base speed is 30ft, + 5ft per 2 points of agility.
    • Gold: Start with 1d100 + 50 gp.

Classes

  • Tank: The frontline defender with high health and defensive skills. Specializes in absorbing damage.
  • Mage: A spellcaster with a wide range of magical abilities, from offense to healing.
  • Professional: The versatile problem-solver, skilled in areas like lock-picking and engineering.
  • Support: The medic, focused on healing allies through magic or herbalism.
  • Merchant: The master of trade, specializing in negotiation, crafting, and commerce.

Paths & Talents

Path: Represents your character’s progression and growth in power. Gaining new skills and enhancing existing ones shapes your character’s journey.

Talents: Customizable skills and abilities that add unique aspects to your character. These allow for personalized development and specialization.

Experience & Progression

  • Experience Points (XP): Earned through adventures, XP is used to improve your character.
  • Progression: Each class path has 10 steps, requiring 10 XP per step to advance.
  • Class and Talent Progression:
    • Path progression is linear, unlocking new class abilities.
    • Talent progression allows players to choose from a pool of skills.
  • Spending XP: Use XP to enhance class features, talents, or unique aspects of your character.

Classes

Tank

As a Tank, your character embodies the very essence of strength, resilience, and unyielding fortitude. You are the shield that safeguards your allies, the bulwark that stands firm in the face of the enemy onslaught. With every swing of your weapon, you command the battlefield, drawing the attention of foes and absorbing their blows that would otherwise kill your companions and many other creatures as well. Your unmatched stamina and formidable armor make you a veritable living fortress, capable of withstanding onslaughts that would obliterate the less hardy.

However, the Tank's might in combat comes with a trade-off. In situations that require finesse, diplomacy, or arcane knowledge, you may find yourself akin to a fish out of water. While your strength and endurance are beyond question, tasks that involve subtlety, stealth, or intricate problem-solving might present a challenge. It's in these moments that you'll need to rely on your allies, just as they depend on your unwavering protection in battle. As a Tank, your role is not to master every situation, but to provide a rock-solid foundation from which your group can confront any danger. Always remember, true strength comes not just from physical power, but from knowing your limits and trusting in your comrades.

Class Features & Equipment

Features

  • Walking Fortress: Gain +10 Wounds, suffer no penalties from wearing armor, and carry 3 hefty items before becoming pinned.
  • Champion Points: Start with 4 Champion Points.
    • Regain 1 point on Press On or all points on a long rest.
    • Regain points by killing an enemy, making them yield, or when an enemy fails a morale check.
  • Champion Strike: Spend 1 Champion Point to add [[1d6]] to your attack check and damage.
  • Champion’s Endurance: Spend 1 Champion Point to heal +10 or remove 1 condition as an action.

Equipment

  • Heavy Armor: 20 armor
  • Choose:
    • Standard Weapon: (Agi or Str; 1 hand, Light; [[1d6]] Physical)
    • Hefty Weapon: (Str; 2 hand, Hefty Strength as Physical damage)
  • Choose:
    • Standard Ranged: (Agi; 2 Hand, Medium Range, Reload; [[1d10]] Piercing)
    • Siege Crossbow: (Str; 2 hand, Hefty, Medium Range, mechanical, reload; [[2d6]] Piercing)
Paths

As a Tank, your path is a steadfast journey of fortitude and resilience. Each level unlocks greater defensive skills and the ability to withstand more formidable foes. This path fortifies you with abilities that transform you into an unbreakable shield, marking milestones of endurance and protection in your journey.

Champion

The Champion stands as a paragon of battle, a warrior whose very presence on the frontline is a testament to their unmatched prowess and indomitable spirit. Forged in the crucible of countless conflicts, the Champion is the embodiment of the warrior ideal; fearless, relentless, and awe-inspiring. They do not just participate in battles; they lead them, setting the pace and tone of the engagement with their aggressive tactics and unyielding force.

Champion Maneuver

When you use Champion Strike, you can make your attack as a Half-Action instead of an action.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Valiant Defender: As a reaction, when an ally within reach range takes damage, you can reduce the damage by half.
  2. Shield Wall: As an action, create a protective barrier that grants you and allies within reach +10 armor until the end of your next turn.
  3. Iron Will: When you use Champion Strike, you gain +10 armor until the end of your next turn.
  4. Last Stand: When you are reduced to 0 wounds, instead of taking the injured condition, you gain +1 wound and immediately take an action. Can only be used once per long rest.
  5. Valiant Defender II: When you use Valiant Defender, your ally takes no damage instead of half.
  6. Champion’s Strength: When you use Champion’s Endurance, heal yourself for +10 and remove 1 condition.
  7. Battle Roar: As an action spending a Champion Point, all allies within short range can make a melee attack immediately as a free action.
  8. Rallying Cry: As an action, rally your allies, granting you and them [[3d10]] temporary armor. Each ally must be able to hear you and be within short range.
  9. Street Brawler: When you use Champion Strike, you can grapple an enemy as a free action on a strength check. While grappling, you can make an additional unarmed attack each turn when you take the attack action.
  10. Unstoppable Champion: As an action spending 4 Champion Points, become immune to damage and conditions until the end of your next turn.
Child of Fenrir

The Child of Fenrir is a path shrouded in the ancient and formidable legacy of the legendary wolf Fenrir. Those who walk this path channel the untamed might and the deep-rooted spirituality of the wolf, embodying a force that is both awe-inspiring and fearsome. As a Child of Fenrir, you are not just a warrior; you are a symbol of primal power and freedom, a living testament to the wild spirit that Fenrir represents. Your presence on the battlefield is more than physical - it is a manifestation of the raw essence of nature’s most revered and mystical predator. This path is a calling for those who resonate with the strength, agility, and spiritual depth of the wolf, transcending species and form to tap into something ancient and powerful at the very core of existence.

Fenrir's Bite

You have a bite that deals damage equal to your Strength check. On a success plus, recover wounds equal to half the damage dealt.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Lupine Agility: Gain +2 Agility. You have advantage on checks for agility that involve movement, traversal, or speed.
  2. Fenris' Whisper: You can communicate telepathically with canines and wolf-like creatures within medium range. Additionally, you can sense the intentions of any predatory creature, giving advantage on Survey checks against predatory creatures.
  3. Howl of Chains: As an action, unleash a howl affecting creatures within short range. These creatures you choose must make a Spirit check or become enveloped in shadow chains causing the pinned condition until the end of your next turn.
  4. Predator's Instinct: You can track creatures by scent and have advantage on Survival checks to track living creatures. Additionally, while in shadow, gain advantage on Stealth checks, ideal for ambushes or evading detection.
  5. Spiritual Resonance: As a half-action, tap into the spiritual energy of Fenris to sense magical auras within medium range. This can be used to identify spellcasters, magical traps, or enchanted objects.
  6. Alpha Dominance: You have power over beasts. As an action targeting 1 or more creatures within reach range, make a Spirit check contested with the beast. If you succeed, the beast will follow commands for 1 minute, after which it will flee in fear.
  7. Fenrir's Wrath: As an action, unleash powerful shadows with an area attack within short range targeting up to 6 creatures. Deals [[3d6]] eclipse damage. Enemies must make an Agility check or take full damage, half as much per success.
  8. Territorial Awareness: Mark an area as your territory—this can be a homestead, town, or a city district. Within this territory, when combat begins, you gain an additional action for the first round. You can identify the types of creatures in your territory and know their intentions.
  9. Apex of the Wild: You can call upon nature spirits for aid. As an action, summon 3 wolf spirits (PL 3) that remain for 1 minute. You can command them, and they will follow your commands to the best of their ability.
  10. Cataclysmic Howl: Unleash a devastating howl that can be heard across planes. Enemies within medium range must make a Spirit check. On a failure, they become stunned until the end of their next turn and take [[4d8]] thunder damage. This howl can also break barriers and dispel illusions.
Elevant

The Elevant wields the raw power of the elements like a virtuoso commanding a symphony, blending artistry with destruction. Each movement is a calculated gesture, orchestrating fire, water, earth, and air in harmony to shield allies, inspire courage, and overwhelm enemies. As a conductor of elemental forces, the Elevant turns the battlefield into a dynamic stage where their every action resonates with power and precision.

Elemental Melody

Your presence radiates elemental energy. As a half-action, cause enemies within reach range to take [[1d4]] elemental damage.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Symphony: Your melee attacks deal an additional 3 elemental damage.
  2. Melody II: Your Elemental Melody now deals [[2d6]] elemental damage.
  3. Echo: When you deal elemental damage, spend a Champion Point to deal the elemental damage to a secondary target within short range (only the elemental damage, not the total damage).
  4. Overture: As a half-action, perform an elemental overture that inspires allies, granting them advantage on their next attack roll and +3 damage until the end of your next turn.
  5. Harmonic Shift: As a half-action, hum with elemental energy and teleport up to a short range, leaving behind a line of elemental energy that deals 1 elemental damage to creatures that pass through it.
  6. Cacophony: As a reaction, when an ally within short range is about to be hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
  7. Echo II: When you use Echo, deal damage to a third target and add an additional [[1d6]] to all targets.
  8. Overture II: When you use Overture, give allies an additional [[1d6]] damage on their attacks until the end of your next turn.
  9. Elemental Rebirth: When you are reduced to 0 wounds, instead of taking the injured condition, you can spend 2 Champion Points to regain 10 wounds and release a burst of elemental energy, dealing [[3d6]] elemental damage to enemies within reach range.
  10. Elemental Storm: As an action, the Elevant unleashes a “crescendo” by conducting an explosive symphony of elemental energy that pulses outward in rhythmic waves. Each wave deals [[8d8]] elemental damage and disrupts nearby enemies’ abilities to act (inflicts the Deafened condition or imposes Disadvantage on spells or ranged attacks for a turn). The Elevant experiences Exhaustion and Disoriented conditions as they channel such intense elemental music.
Faith Bound

The Faith Bound walks a precarious path between devotion and self-discovery, embodying the struggle to reconcile divine purpose with personal conviction. They are champions of their deity, wielding holy power to protect and heal, yet their internal conflict fuels their greatest strength. Every action they take reflects the tension between their loyalty to a higher power and their own sense of identity, granting them the ability to adapt to the needs of the moment.

Shifting Resolve

At the start of your day, make a choice between these two abilities:

  • Strength of God: You gain a +2 to checks in combat.
  • Strength of Self: You gain a +2 to checks outside of combat.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Divine Emissary: As an action spending a Champion Point, you can channel divine energy to heal a creature within short range, restoring [[2d6]] wounds. Additionally, you can enter a meditative state for 1 minute, gaining advantage on your next Observation check.
  2. Divine Beacon: As an action spending 1 Champion Point, illuminate yourself with divine light, healing your allies and damaging enemies for [[2d6]]. The light can also dispel darkness spells and fear effects, symbolizing your role as a beacon of hope.
  3. Enhanced Shifting Resolve: Your Shifting Resolve ability now grants a +4 bonus to checks.
  4. True Unity: As a Free Action spending a Champion Point, you can activate both Strength of God and Strength of Self simultaneously for 1 minute. While this is active, allies within medium range have +1 to their checks.
  5. Celestial Insight: As an Off-Action, gain the ability to perceive celestial and Vozian influences in the world around you until the end of your next turn. This can reveal hidden auras, detect lies influenced by dark powers, or sense divine providence at work, enriching exploration and interactions.
  6. Ascendant Armor: As a Half-Action, gain +10 armor until the end of your next turn.
  7. Consecrated Ground: As an action, transform a short-range area into holy ground until the end of your next turn. Allies in the range gain +10 armor, and enemies have disadvantage on their attacks until the end of their next turn.
  8. Avatar Ascendant (Partial): As an action spending 2 Champion Points, you become an avatar of your god until the end of your next turn. You gain immunity to Corpus conditions, and your attacks deal additional damage equal to your Spirit check.
  9. Divine Arbitration: As an action spending a Champion Point, call upon your deity to intervene directly in a moment of great need. This could manifest as a powerful smite against foes for [[20]] Solar damage, a mass healing wave of [[10]] healing to all allies within medium range, or an irrefutable command issued with divine authority to an enemy of your choice.
  10. Avatar Ascendant (Full): You can now channel the full power of your deity, transforming into an avatar of faith for 1 minute. In this form, you gain immunity to conditions and damage. Your melee attacks deal an extra [[6d6]] Solar damage and have an additional +10 to the check, showcasing the true power of your faith. After using this ability, you must make a Spirit check at disadvantage. On a failure, your body and mind are given to your god, and you cease to exist as your body and soul are taken into the Celestial realm.
Forsaken

The Forsaken was once a devout believer in the gods, but their faith was shattered when they were betrayed and abandoned by the very deities they worshiped. This deep betrayal has fueled their desire for revenge and a vow to end the tyranny of the gods. They have vowed to become more powerful than any god and bring justice to the world.

Vow of Death

If you take the death condition, make a Spirit check. On a success, you will yourself back to life, removing the death condition. You cannot do this again for 1 month.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Vengeful Defiance: While making an attack action, spend a Champion Point to deal an additional [[1d6]] damage and gain the total damage as armor until the end of your next turn.
  2. Rite of the Godslayer: As an Off-Action, mark a foe as a target of your divine retribution. The marked target takes an additional [[1d6]] damage from you.
  3. Unwavering Stance: After taking this stance, you can negate any damage until the start of your next turn, but you take the Pinned condition until the end of your next turn.
  4. Sanctuary Aura: Immune to tracking through divine or magical means. While resting, you automatically create a protective aura that renders you and your party undetectable to creatures' spying, tracking, or scrying efforts.
  5. Relentless Pursuit: You can use Vow of Death once per long rest. When you use Vow of Death, you regain wounds equal to your Spirit. Additionally, you can immediately take an action, choosing a creature within short range. Gain advantage on attack rolls against that creature and increase your movement speed by short range until the end of your next turn.
  6. Aura of Defiance: As an action spending a Champion Point, activate an Aura of Defiance, granting all allies within short range +10 armor. Their attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] Vozian damage until the end of their next turn.
  7. Rite of the Godslayer II: Increase the damage of Rite of the Godslayer to [[3d6]]. When you mark a target, they cannot hide from you while on the same plane, and you also learn any weaknesses they might have.
  8. Vengeful Godslayer: Vengeful Defiance damage is increased to [[3d6]], gaining twice the damage as armor that lasts for 1 minute.
  9. Vengeful Fury: When you use Vengeful Defiance, your critical damage is tripled.
  10. Avatar of Vengeance: As an action, transform into an avatar of vengeance for 1 hour. In this form, you gain immunity to all damage and conditions, and your melee attacks deal an extra [[3d6]] necrotic damage. After the hour, your body decays, and you permanently lose [[1d6]] wounds.
Knight of Perdition

The Knight of Perdition is a fearsome warrior bound by a pact with demonic forces, wielding unparalleled power at a devastating personal cost. Cloaked in a sinister aura of shadows and dread, these knights dominate the battlefield with devastating strikes, unyielding defenses, and supernatural agility. Their Veil of Perdition is both their greatest weapon and their most haunting burden, granting them dark gifts that inspire fear and awe in all who stand against them.

Veil of Perdition

When you use Champion’s Endurance, gain +10 armor until the end of your next turn.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Elemental Shroud: When you activate Veil of Perdition, also gain an additional Off-Action.
  2. Eclipse Shield: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your armor lasts until you Press On or Long Rest.
  3. Reach of the Abyss: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your melee attacks deal an additional [[1d4]] eclipse damage.
  4. Shadow Veil: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.
  5. Shadow Step: When you activate Veil of Perdition, teleport up to short range to an unoccupied space that you can see.
  6. Aura of Dread: When you activate Veil of Perdition, enemies within a short range must succeed on a spirit check or gain the fear condition.
  7. Umbral Regeneration: When you activate Veil of Perdition, heal for [[1d10]].
  8. Dreadful Dominance: When you activate Veil of Perdition, force one enemy within sight to make a spirit check; on a failure, they follow a simple command you give them that does not result in self-harm.
  9. Shroud of Night: When you activate Veil of Perdition, blend into shadows, gaining advantage on stealth checks and causing the first attack made from stealth to automatically crit.
  10. Lord of Perdition: When you activate the Veil of Perdition, your physical form intensifies in dread, intimidating all enemies within sight to make a spirit check or be stunned until the end of their next turn.
Spell Breaker

Having been shunned by traditional spell schools, the Spell Breaker has delved into the dark and forbidden arts of anti-magic. They have sworn to rid the world of the dangers of magic and those who wield it without restraint. With a somber and gloomy demeanor, the Spell Breaker walks a lonely path, haunted by the atrocities unleashed by reckless spellcasters.

Saving Grace Stance

As a half-action, take this stance. Spells within short range of you have disadvantage on their checks against you until the end of your next turn.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Magic Disruption: You have advantage on checks against spells and magical effects. When subjected to a condition from a spell or magical effect, make an Intellect check to prevent it.
  2. Anti-Magic Knight: When making a weapon attack, you can spend a spell point to increase either the check or the damage by +3. Alternatively, as an action using a spell point, gain [[6]] armor per spell point used.
  3. Magical Insight: Gain the ability to detect the presence and intensity of magical effects within your vicinity. This does not require spell points but provides valuable information about magical traps, enchantments, or artifacts, enhancing investigation and lore discovery.
  4. Stance Hold: When you take the Saving Grace Stance as a half-action, you can take an additional stance at the same time, receiving the benefits of both until the end of your next turn.
  5. Anti-Mage: Gain spell points equal to your Intellect.
  6. Counter-Cast Parry: After using Anti-Magic Knight and a creature attacks you after your turn, you can spend a spell point to reduce the damage by half as an off-action.
  7. Mirror Spell: You can cast any spells you have seen within the last minute as an action with an Intellect check, using half the number of spell points used but must be cast within short range.
  8. Anti-Mage Recovery: As an action spending 2 spell points, you can heal for +4 or remove a Corpus condition.
  9. Disenchanter: As a 10-minute action spending 6 spell points, you can remove negative effects from items like curses or tainted magic.
  10. The Spell Breaker: Spending a champion point as an action, you become immune to any words of power or magical abilities unless cast by a god for 1 minute.
Tide Sentinel

The Tide Sentinel embodies the unyielding power and grace of the ocean, wielding water as both a shield and a weapon. They channel the boundless energy of the tides to heal allies, manipulate the battlefield, and summon aquatic allies to aid in combat. Whether calming the chaos or unleashing a torrent of destruction, the Tide Sentinel is a master of adaptability, making them an invaluable force both in battle and beyond.

Ocean Spray

As an off-action, when you attack an enemy with a melee weapon, deal half the total damage in water damage to all creatures in melee range.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Ocean's Lorekeeper: You have extensive knowledge of sea creatures, maritime lore, and oceanography. Gain advantage on checks related to marine life, sea navigation, and identifying sea-related artifacts.
  2. Healing Waters: When you hit an ally with Ocean Spray, they take healing instead of damage.
  3. Seafarer's Tongue: You can communicate in the language of sea creatures, allowing for interaction with dolphins, whales, and other intelligent aquatic life. This can be used to gather information, seek guidance, or ask for assistance from sea creatures.
  4. Riptide: Summon a tide water, and as a half-action, your weapon becomes imbued with the tide waters and deals water damage for 1 minute, dealing an additional +1 damage.
  5. Call of the Deep: As an action, use a champion point to call upon sea creatures for assistance. Summon a swarm of PL4 small crabs or a giant octopus for a turn, which will attack your enemies or create obstacles.
  6. Hydro-Illusion: While laying still in water that covers your whole form, you are treated as invisible.
  7. Ocean Spray II: Your Ocean Spray deals the full damage to creatures nearby.
  8. Shipshape: You excel at ship maintenance and repairs. Gain advantage on Crafting checks to repair or maintain boats and ships, and you can temporarily boost ship speed with your knowledge of optimal rigging and sail adjustments.
  9. Coral Fortress: When you take a defensive stance, gain spikes of coral that deal [[1d4]] damage to creatures that hit you with a melee attack.
  10. Oceanic Dominion: For your ultimate ability, gain control over all water within a large radius for 1 minute. You can manipulate water to form barriers, propel allies forward, or crash against enemies as waves, each wave dealing [[6d6]] water damage.
Titanblood

Titanblood warriors are the living embodiment of their colossal ancestry, channeling the raw might of ancient giants to dominate the battlefield. Their bodies adapt to their surroundings, becoming unyielding as stone or expanding to titanic proportions. Through sheer physical power, they unleash seismic destruction, shatter the ground beneath their foes, and reshape the battlefield to their will. Driven by a primal rage and boundless strength, Titanbloods leap into combat with apocalyptic force, creating devastating fissures and leaving entire landscapes scarred by their might. They are immovable forces, unstoppable powers, and avatars of their titanic lineage.

Titanic Slam

As an action, create a shockwave by slamming the ground, dealing [[1d4]] Impact damage to creatures within reach range. Affected creatures must make a Strength check or take the Prone condition.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Tremor Shield: Whenever you are hit by a melee attack, you can spend 1 Champion Point as an off-action to release a tremor, forcing all enemies within reach range to succeed on a Physical check or fall prone. This reaction can be used while in Titanic Growth without spending Champion Points.
  2. Colossus: You become an indomitable force, unaffected by enemy interference. Gain immunity to the Pinned condition and reduce the effects of Knockback by half.
  3. Bloodrage: As a half-action, go into a Bloodrage that lasts until the end of your next turn unless you deal damage to a living creature before the end of your next turn. While in Bloodrage, your melee attacks deal additional damage equal to your Strength.
  4. Seismic Slam: When you use Titanic Slam, you can use it in a line up to short range instead of an area of effect.
  5. Physical Adaptation: Your body instinctively adjusts to match your environment. As an action, you can compress or expand your size to fit your needs. While compressed, gain +2 to Stealth. While expanded, gain +2 to Strength.
  6. Apocalyptic Descent: As an action, leap into the air and land with titanic force in a location within short range. All creatures within reach range of the impact point take [[1d10]] Impact damage and must succeed on a Strength check or take the Prone condition. The terrain in the impact radius becomes difficult terrain.
  7. Bloodrage II: While in Bloodrage, gain advantage to Strength, Agility, and Survival checks. You can also choose to maintain the Bloodrage by taking -4 stress damage.
  8. Tremor Shield II: When you use Tremor Shield, deal [[1d10]] Impact damage.
  9. Apocalyptic Descent II: Increase the damage of Apocalyptic Descent to [[2d10]] + your Strength.
  10. Worldbreaker: As an action, slam into the ground with your full titan force, creating fissures in a long-range line in any 2 directions you choose. They have a width of 20ft, and creatures in the line of the fissure must make a Strength or Agility check to not fall in. Creatures that fall in are wedged between your fissures. These fissures remain until the end of your next turn, but you are unable to move or act until the end of your next turn while you force the fissures to close, trapping the creatures that fell in for eternity in the ground.
Plaguebringer

The Plaguebringer is a master of disease, decay, and the darker aspects of nature. They understand the delicate balance between life and death and can manipulate it to their advantage. This talent is perfect for players who enjoy using cunning and strategy over brute force, affecting entire battlefields with debilitating diseases, controlling vermin and insects, and wielding the fear of contagion as a weapon.

Plagued One

You are immune to disease. Your attacks cause a simple disease on failed Survival checks that allows you to track your foe while they are on the same plane as you. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures that have your disease. Your disease lasts for 1 week if left untreated.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Infectious Cough: When a creature is initially infected with your disease, they take the coughing condition until the end of their next turn.
  2. Brain Fog: When a creature is infected with your disease, they take the Confused condition.
  3. Fear of Death: The first time a creature is infected with your disease, they hallucinate their worst fears and must make an Intellect check or take the fear condition.
  4. Toxic Retribution: As a reaction, when struck in melee combat, release a burst of toxic spores dealing [[1d6]] toxic damage.
  5. Decay Aura: Your presence accelerates decay and disease. Armor and weapons of enemies begin to rust and degrade. As an action, touch an armored creature or vehicle to cause [[1d6]] acid damage.
  6. Pathogen Mastery: As an action, release a cloud of virulent pathogens that infect enemies within reach range. Creatures must make a Survival check or become infected with your disease. While infected, you can deal [[1d6]] damage to them as an off-action.
  7. Epidemic Spread: If an enemy is slain while they have your disease, they burst with a cloud of virulent pathogens within short range. All creatures you choose within that range must make Survival checks or contract your disease.
  8. Carrion Call: As an action, summon a swarm of PL2 carrion birds or insects as allies. These can harass enemies, obscure vision, or heal [[1d4]] to you by feasting on creatures you infected.
  9. Dreaded Ground: As an action, transform the terrain within short range into diseased land, causing it to become difficult terrain. Allies moving through this area regain [[1d4]] wounds at the start of their turn.
  10. Disease of Unity: As an action, unleash the ultimate form of your disease. All allies and enemies within medium range can choose to make a Survival check or take your disease. Allies gain 6 healing at the start of their turn, reducing by 1 per round. Enemies take 6 toxic damage at the start of their turn, reducing by 1 per round.
Talent

Tank Talents are your arsenal of survival and defense. They define your unique approach to absorbing damage and shielding allies. Whether it's an unyielding stance or a protective maneuver, these Talents forge your identity as the group's bastion.

Bannerlord

The Bannerlord is a flamboyant and charismatic creature who wields different banners to grant various auras to themselves and their allies. They are known for their showmanship and flair in battle, using their performance, voice, and colorful banners to captivate their audience and sway the tides of combat.

Banner Action

As an action, place a banner. This banner has an aura of reach range and lasts for 1 minute. You have 2 banners per day. You can have more than one banner active at a time.

Banner of Protection

As an action, place down a banner. Any allied creatures within reach range of the banner gain 3 additional armor to a maximum of 3 from this feature at the start of their turn.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Quick Deployment: You can place a banner as a half-action instead of a full action.
  • Bolstering Banner: Increase the range of your banners to short range.
  • Banner of Illusion: This banner can create illusions. You can select the type of illusions the banner manifests, such as Doppelgangers, Illusory Terrain, Phantasmal Foes, or Concealing Fog, adding a layer of deception and confusion to your strategies.
  • Banner of Invisibility: Creatures within the banner's range become invisible, although the banner remains visible.
  • Banner of Swiftness: Upon placement, your banner boosts you and your allies' agility and speed within its range, allowing two attacks when taking the Attack action.
  • Banner of Valor: Upon deployment, allies within the range gain advantage on their attack rolls.
  • Held Banner: You can activate one banner while holding it in your off-hand, providing its effects within its range. Simultaneously, you have the option to deploy another banner.
  • Banner of the Undying: This banner inspires allies and protects them from death. When reduced to 0 wounds, they automatically regain 1 wound. This feature can only be used once per creature.
  • Bannerbound: As an action, you can teleport to any active banner within medium range. Additionally, your banners' duration is increased to 1 hour.
  • Banner of Safety: This banner, when placed, becomes a doorway to a cozy home of your design that can comfortably fit 6 medium-sized creatures. It remains for 8 hours or until the banner is removed or destroyed. The banner from the outside looks like any of your banners, but when a creature enters the range, they see the home.
Cavalier

The Cavalier combines the ruggedness of a cowboy with the chivalry of a knight. This talent is for those who excel in mounted combat, blending wilderness survival skills with honorable combat techniques. They are adept at navigating rough terrains and are skilled in using their environment to their advantage, whether in a jousting tournament or a wild west showdown.

Movement Synergy

While mounted, you may combine your movement with your mount's.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Whispers of the Wild: As an off-action, communicate telepathically with any willing creature. However, the first time you speak to a creature, it must make an Observation check or take the fear condition. Once a creature succeeds on this check, it's immune to this fear effect from you in the future. The telepathic voice sounds like their greatest fear, and creatures are initially unaware of who is speaking.
  • Ravenous Bite: You have a bite attack, it deals [[1d4]] damage. When you hit with a success+, the bitten creature must make a Survival check or take the Ravenous Curse. If a creature has the Ravenous Curse within short range of you, gain an additional [[1d4]] attack bonus per cursed creature.
  • Chilling Touch: Your hands are unnaturally cold. When you hit with unarmed strikes, deal an additional [[1d4]] ice damage.
  • Unnatural Speed: Your movement becomes eerily swift and silent. Gain +3 Agility and +3 Stealth, and you also have advantage on Stealth checks in forested or cold environments.
  • Frost Walker: Traverse without leaving tracks or suffering movement penalties. Additionally, gain 2 resistance to ice damage.
  • Nightmarish Grasp: Your arms transform into elongated, monstrous limbs. Increase your melee range by +5 feet, and your grip can cause hallucinations, forcing any target grappled by you to make a Survey check or experience terrifying visions, taking the fear condition.
  • Skinwalker Camouflage: Blend into natural surroundings perfectly. When remaining still in natural terrain, become invisible.
  • Insatiable Hunger: Gain the ability to consume flesh as a 1-minute action to heal [[2d6]] wounds or remove 1 condition. Eating flesh of defeated enemies restores you but may have other psychological effects. Creatures that see you in this act must make a Survey check or take the fear condition. When you eat a corpse, you can disguise yourself as the creature you ate for 24 hours.
  • Winter's Veil: You can create a localized blizzard around yourself as a defensive mechanism. This blizzard obscures vision and imposes disadvantage on attacks against you. Melee attackers take 1 ice damage when they hit you with an attack.
  • Hunter: As a half-action, mark a target with touch as your prey. You always know where they are if they are on this plane and slowly learn more about them, gaining more knowledge each day. They know something is wrong but don't know why.
Detective

The Gritty Detective talent harnesses the hard-boiled, relentless determination of a detective, weaving an intricate balance between brawn and brains. As a Gritty Detective, you combine your muscular might with a sharp intellect to penetrate the murkiest mysteries and hold the frontline in any battle.

Hard-Boiled

When the going gets tough, you get tougher. Start with +5 armor.

Sherlock's Gaze

Your keen eye for detail and deductive reasoning is a powerful asset. As a Half-Action, spend a Champion Point to reveal vital clues or hidden information in your surroundings if there is any.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Interrogator: You know how to get information out of people. Spend a Champion Point to make an Influence check with advantage when trying to persuade someone to reveal information. This could help you get a confession from a suspect, persuade a witness to talk, or intimidate a thug into revealing his boss's plans.
  • Quick Reflexes: Your detective instincts allow you to react quickly to danger. Spend a Champion Point to take an additional off-action (reaction) during a round. This could allow you to dodge an unexpected attack, catch a falling object, or react to a sudden change in the situation.
  • Master of Disguise: You can blend into any crowd. Spend a Champion Point to make a Stealth or Influence Check with advantage when trying to disguise yourself or blend into a crowd.
  • Tactical Analysis: You can quickly assess a situation and devise a plan. Spend a Champion Point to give all allies a +2 bonus on their next check or attack.
  • Unseen Strike: You know how to hit where it hurts. Spend a Champion Point to make an additional attack with advantage and deal an additional [[1d4]] damage on a hit.
  • Healthy Heart: When you heal from any source, heal for +3 more.
  • Dirty Fighter: You know how to fight dirty to gain the upper hand. Spend a Champion Point on an attack to cause one of these Conditions: Bleeding, Coughing, Pinned, Prone, or Blind.
  • Knockout Punch: You can deliver a powerful punch that can knock an enemy unconscious. Spend a Champion Point and make a melee attack action that, on a hit, forces the target to succeed on a Strength or Survival check or take the Stunned condition until the end of their next turn.
  • Desperation Strike: When the odds are against you, you can make a desperate attack that hits no matter what. Spend a Champion Point to make an additional melee or ranged attack that automatically hits, but only deals 1 damage.
  • Quantum Pocket Watch: You possess a strange pocket watch that seems to exist in multiple places at once. As an action, pull out an item that you need from the watch, as long as it's something you could reasonably carry in your pocket (like a key, a coin, a small tool, etc.). The item disappears back into the watch and cannot be used for 1 hour.
Ironclad

The Ironclad is a bastion of defense, a tank whose very presence on the battlefield is akin to a movable fortress. They are the embodiment of resilience, standing firm in the face of overwhelming odds and ensuring that their allies remain protected. Drawing upon the concept of divine protection seen in the Drifting Vicar, the Ironclad instead channels their conviction into an unwavering resolve to defend and protect.

Heavily Armored

Your armor has +10 additional armor.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Impenetrable Defense: You can bolster your defenses to withstand powerful attacks. As an action, use a champion point to double your Armor Points until the end of your next turn.
  • Iron Sanctuary: As an action, use a champion point to create a sanctuary of reach range that lasts for 1 minute. Allies while in the sanctuary gain +2 armor at the start of their turn to a maximum of 10 while in the sanctuary. The bonus armor remains while the sanctuary is active.
  • Inspiring Command: Radiating an aura of confidence and bravery, inspire allies to fight with greater ferocity. As an action, spend a champion point; for 1 minute, all allies within short range receive a +2 bonus to attack checks and damage.
  • Champion Rest: You can meditate to regain your prowess. During a Press On, make a Spirit check to regain [[1d6]] champion points per success.
  • Iron Resolve: As an action spending a champion point, fortify your mental and physical resolve, gaining immunity to Cognitive Conditions for the next minute.
  • Dual Stance: You can take 2 stances at a time, each requiring a half-action.
  • Ironclad Stance: Enter an ironclad stance as a half-action, reducing all incoming damage by a flat amount equal to your Strength.
  • Ironclad Rally: As an action spending a champion point, let out a battlecry. Allies within short range gain [[1d6]] armor, and enemies must make a Spirit check at advantage or take the fear condition.
  • Defender's Rebuke: When a creature makes an attack against you, spend a champion point and deal [[1d6]] physical damage without a check against the attacking creature.
Pugilist

The Pugilist is a seasoned fighter who has honed their body into the perfect weapon. These individuals combine physical prowess with a deep understanding of their inner energy, hailing from mysterious dojos or self-taught from scraps of ancient knowledge. Combining traditional pugilism with an understanding of energy flow within the body, these fighters are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield and in the ring.

Pugilist's Pride

Your Unarmed Attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] physical damage of your choice.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Master of the Ring: once per long rest, as an action, challenge a single creature that can understand you to a duel. If a creature does not wish to duel, they can make a contested Spirit check to break the duel. While dueling, either creature has disadvantage on checks against creatures other than the dueling opponents.
  • Champion Attack: Spend a champion point to gain one additional unarmed attack.
  • Endurance Fighter: Combat empowers you, healing your wounds. When you attack, heal for +1 wounds.
  • Iron Chin: As an off-action, reduce incoming melee damage by your Strength once per Press On.
  • Power Punch: Add your Strength to your unarmed strike damage.
  • Toughen Up: Gain +10 armor at the start of each combat.
  • Showstopper: Perform a flashy and devastating unarmed strike or maneuver. Roll an Influence check against your opponent's Observation check. On a success, the target is Charmed until the end of their next turn. If the check exceeds the opponent’s by 10 or more, the target also takes the fear condition.
  • Fast Striker: When making an unarmed strike, attack twice as part of the action.
  • Battle Instincts: As an off-action, gain advantage on your next attack and disengage as a free action.
  • Crowd Work: When fighting in front of an audience or crowd (allies count), gain +2 to all Influence checks, and creatures who witness your performance are more inclined to favor you afterward.
Resonant

Resonant Shadows are warriors attuned to the vibrations of reality, wielding sound and time as their weapons. They create spectral echoes of themselves that confuse enemies, amplify their strikes, and warp the battlefield. By splitting their presence, they become a relentless force, striking from multiple angles and manipulating their surroundings with sound and temporal power. Whether retracing the steps of the past, leaving lingering impressions, or shattering foes with thunderous energy, Resonant Shadows are masters of disorientation and control. Their abilities grow as they harness the power of echoes and vibrations, making them unpredictable and unstoppable.

Echo Strike

When you make a weapon attack, make another at disadvantage.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Resonant Stride: When you take the dash action, deal [[1d4]] thunder damage to all creatures within reach range where you start your dash.
  • Phantom Assault: As an action, summon a PL3 echo that strikes alongside you and has all of your abilities. It lasts for 1 minute. You can have a number of echoes equal to half your agility.
  • Sonic Shroud: As an off-action, emit a constant hum that cloaks you in disorienting soundwaves. Until the end of your next turn, attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
  • Echo Collapse: Collapse all active echoes to unleash devastating soundwaves. Each echo deals [[1d6]] thunder damage to all creatures within reach range, and creatures must succeed on a Strength check of 15 or be knocked prone.
  • Echo Strike II: When you make an Echo Strike, it's no longer at disadvantage.
  • Temporal Overdrive: As a free-action, gain an additional turn taken on your turn, but afterward, you take the Exhausted, Stunned, and Coughing conditions, ending 1 at the end of each turn for 3 turns.
  • Whispered Memories: Tune into the vibrations of past events. By standing still and focusing for 1 minute, you can listen to echoes of the past in your current location. This allows you to learn a summary of significant events that occurred in the last 24 hours. The narrator determines what details are revealed based on the location's history.
  • Resonant Scream: As an action, you and your echoes scream at a target of your choice. Each scream deals [[1d4!]] damage.
  • Reverberating Step: As an action, your movements leave subtle vibrations in your wake for 1 hour. As you travel, you leave a trail of resonant energy. This trail can be “played back” to retrace your steps or teleport to a point within the hour, ending this effect immediately. If hostile creatures cross the trail, they trigger a faint hum that alerts you. After the hour, you take the Frozen, Blind, and Confused conditions, ending 1 at the end of each turn for 3 turns.
  • Echoed Presence: Your presence lingers long after you’ve left. As an action, after leaving an area, you can choose to leave a faint echo of yourself there for up to 24 hours. The echo cannot interact with the environment but can be seen and heard delivering a pre-recorded message or performing simple movements.
Savage

The Savage is a primal force of nature, unshackled by civilization and driven by raw instinct. Whether forged in the untamed wilds or drawn to its feral ways, you embody the essence of the beast. Your combat style is relentless and chaotic, channeling the fury of the wilderness to overwhelm foes and protect what is yours. With every strike, roar, and pounce, the Savage unleashes unbridled power, leaving devastation in their wake.

Frenzy

On your turn in combat, you can choose to go into a frenzy. When you choose to do so, spend a champion point and roll [[1d4]]. You gain that many additional attacks. After your attacks, you take the Exhaustion condition until the end of your next turn.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Predator's Pounce: As a half-action, pounce on an enemy within reach range that is large size or smaller, knocking them prone on a contested Strength check.
  • Savage Strike: Deal additional damage equal to your Strength check on melee attacks.
  • Bloodlust: Killing an enemy increases your damage by [[1d6]] until the end of your next turn.
  • Hardened Body: Gain +10 armor and +10 wounds.
  • Unrelenting Spirit: Corpus conditions caused by a Success+ or greater only last until the end of your next turn, and you are immune to the Pinned condition.
  • Wild Protection: You have advantage on Survival checks while in nature. While in nature, you can hunt for 1 hour and, with a successful Survival check, gather enough raw food for 2d4 people.
  • Stubborn Frenzy: When you use Frenzy, you can choose to take the Pinned condition instead of Exhaustion.
  • Wild Instincts: As a reaction to taking damage, use a champion point to tap into your primal instincts and reduce its damage by half.
  • Primal Roar: As an action, spend a champion point and unleash a roar affecting all creatures within short range. They must make a Spirit check or take the fear condition with you as the source. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures with the fear condition with you as the source.
  • Rampage: As an action, use a champion point to go on a rampage. Your movement speed is doubled, and you can make an unarmed attack against each enemy you pass during your movement.
Skinwalker

The Horror Shifter taps into the dark and mysterious lore of the skinwalker, possessing the ability to take on aspects of various animals, as well as more terrifying, half-beast forms. This talent is for those who embrace the primal and often unsettling power of shape-shifting, using it to instill fear and leverage the strengths of different creatures. Horror Shifters are not only versatile in combat but also adept at psychological warfare, using their eerie transformations to unnerve and overwhelm opponents.

Mimic Howl

As an action, emit a bone-chilling howl that can demoralize enemies, sounding like familiar voices. Creatures must make an Intellect check or take the fear condition. If they succeed on the check, they become immune to your Mimic Howl.

Progression

You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

Progression Steps

  • Creeping Form: Partially shift as a half-action to gain double movement speed and the ability to climb nearly anything until the end of your next turn.
  • Beastly Insight: Gain the instincts of a predator, giving you advantage on Observation checks to notice hidden creatures, detect lies, or sense hostile intent. Additionally, you can speak Naech (Beast).
  • Pack Instincts: As an off-action, you can coordinate with allies by growling or making signals that communicate tactics or warnings, giving one ally advantage on their next attack against a target you’ve marked.
  • Night Terror: When hit in melee, as a reaction, briefly transform into the target's worst fear, causing them to make an Intellect check or be Stunned for a turn.
  • Veil of Shadows: As an action, gain the invisible condition until the end of your next turn or until you take an aggressive action or cast a spell.
  • Vermin Swarm: Dissolve into a swarm of vermin as a half-action. This allows you to bypass small openings, avoid opportunity attacks, and you have immunity to the pinned condition.
  • Terrifying Transformation: Transform part of your body into a monstrous form, adding [[1d6]] additional damage to unarmed strikes.
  • Shadowed Strike: As an off-action, make a shadow attack against a creature with a Spirit check that deals [[1d6]] eclipse damage. On a Success+, recover wounds equal to the damage.
  • Eerie Mimicry: once per long rest, you can mimic a creature’s mannerisms and voice perfectly for up to 10 minutes, imitating sounds or speech patterns you've heard.
  • Mark of the Beast: Once per short rest, as an off-action, touch a creature and leave your mark, which remains until removed or until you decide to remove it. You always know the direction of this marked target while they are on the same plane as you.
Professional

The Professional is a seasoned individual, having faced the tumultuous tides of time and emerging as a beacon of resilience and expertise. Whether they've survived the brutal trenches of war or navigated the intricate politics of the big city, their experiences have crafted them into unparalleled specialists in their fields. They are the ex-military tacticians employing strategies in the boardroom, the seasoned detectives with an uncanny ability to read a crime scene, or the old-time engineers who've seen the rise of the modern age. Their scars, both visible and hidden, are a testament to their enduring spirit, their stories etched in every line on their face.

A Professional is characterized by their unwavering determination, their vast experience making them adaptable and invaluable. They've seen the world change, and they've changed with it, but their core – forged in the crucible of challenges – remains unyielding. They don't merely survive; they lead, mentor, and inspire.

Class Features & Equipment

Features

  • Professional Knowledge: At character creation, gain an additional 5 points towards your checks to a maximum of 15 for any check, reflecting your wealth of experience. Additionally, you suffer no penalties from wearing Medium armor.
  • Tactical Assessment: As an off-action targeting a creature within short range, gain advantage on checks against them until the end of your next turn, using your experience discerning a target's vulnerabilities and strengths.
  • Professional Specialization: Choose a specialization from the list below (as determined by your Narrator).

Equipment

  • Medium Armor: 10 Armor
  • Standard Weapon: (Agi or Str; 1 hand, Light; [[1d6]] Physical)
  • Standard Ranged: (Agi; 2 Hand, Medium Range, Reload; [[1d10]] Piercing)
Specializations

Professional Specializations

Warrior

Battle-scarred and wise, the Warrior has seen the horrors and glories of war, excelling in strategic combat and resilience.

  • Battle-Hardened: You have +5 Armor. When subjected to the fear condition, you have advantage on saves against it. If there isn't an established save, you can make a survival check against it.

Mercenary

A seasoned fighter for hire, the Mercenary specializes in versatility and adaptability, thriving in unpredictable situations and diverse contracts.

  • Adaptability: You can take a Stance as an action and a half-action, holding 2 stances at once. The stance you take as an action remains until the end of your next turn.

Scout

Masters of reconnaissance and stealth, Scouts excel in gathering intelligence and leading surprise attacks, using their knowledge of terrain to their advantage.

  • Reconnaissance: You can use your Tactical Assessment from Medium Range. When you do so, you cannot lose track of that creature while they are on the same plane as you for 24 hours.

Guardian

Protectors at heart, Guardians are skilled in defensive tactics, prioritizing the safety of their allies and excelling in shielding and interceptive maneuvers.

  • Protector’s Stance: When you take this stance as a half-action and allies within reach take damage from an area of effect or something that targets more than one creature, you reduce the damage to everyone by half.

Gladiator

Born in the arena, Gladiators are entertainers as much as fighters, adept at crowd-pleasing combat and theatrical, yet deadly, showmanship.

  • Crowd Pleaser: You have advantage on Influence Checks in combat and a unique combat maneuver that can intimidate or impress opponents and onlookers, causing morale drops or reducing enemy PL.

Operative

Trained for covert operations, the Operative specializes in precision strikes, espionage, and working from the shadows to take down targets efficiently.

  • Lethal Precision: Gain the ability to strike vital points. When you make a called shot on a creature, roll a [[1d100]]. If it's above 90, reduce the monster PL by -1.

Pirate

Navigators of the high seas, Pirates are adept in aquatic combat and maritime skills, often employing unconventional tactics and a flair for the dramatic.

  • Seafarer's Skill: You can operate any aquatic vehicle and have the ability to navigate by strange means that others don't understand.
  • Sunken Lungs: You can either hold your breath or breathe underwater for 1 hour. You also have a Breath attack: Action, Survival Check, reach range, deals 3 water damage.

Negotiator

With a talent for diplomacy and de-escalation, Negotiators can resolve conflicts without bloodshed, using their words as weapons to achieve their goals.

  • Diplomatic Resolve: If combat initiative is rolled, you get a Diplomatic turn before any other creature. This can only be used for social checks and movement, and no creature can make attacks against you until the end of the Diplomatic turn.

Mystic

Attuned to the esoteric and supernatural, Mystics blend martial skills with mystical insights, often surprising enemies with unorthodox strategies.

  • Spirit Caster: Gain +2 Spirit and +2 Spell Points.

Warden

Guardians of nature and the wilderness, Wardens are adept in outdoor survival and environmental combat, using natural elements to their advantage.

  • Nature’s Blessing: As an action, summon a PL [[1d4]] creature of nature or gain +10 Armor. Each lasts for 1 minute.

Explorer

You’ve always been one to adventure and see the world. You know all of its dangers and how best to avoid them.

  • Maneuverist: Your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Chosen

Marked by destiny or divine favor, the Chosen wield powers or blessings beyond the ordinary, often driven by a higher calling or prophetic mission.

  • Divine Aid: As a 1-minute action, receive cryptic visions, a strange message, or dreams from a divine entity, offering hints or guidance for current quests or goals.
  • Sanctified Ground: As a 1-minute action, you can sanctify an area, providing protection or other benefits to allies within it for 8 hours. This repels creatures that would work against your Motivation or seek to harm you.
Paths

The Professional's path is a testament to battle-hardened experience. Each level reflects a deeper understanding of strategy, weaponry, and combat skills, showcasing your evolution from a seasoned warrior to a master tactician.

Demonologist

The Demonologist has delved deep into the ancient lore of demonic entities, becoming a Professional on their history, methods, and magic. However, this knowledge comes with a cost; they have learned to infuse themselves with the very essence of the demonic entities they study. When they do so, they can tap into incredible power, but it may leave them physically and emotionally drained. This transformation has made them a formidable presence on the battlefield, capable of standing against even the toughest adversaries. Yet, they always walk a thin line between control and madness.

Demonic Infusion

When you use Infernal Infusion, spend 5 Demonic Essence to transform into a demonic form for 1 minute. Gain +2 to all attack rolls, armor equal to double your Intellect, and deal an extra [[1d4]] Vozian damage. After the transformation, you take the blind, confused, and exhausted conditions for 1 minute.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Demonic Resilience: As an action, spend 1 Demonic Essence to heal for [[1d8]] or remove 1 condition on yourself.
  2. Ritual Leader: Conduct infernal rituals (10 minutes) for summoning demons, creating wards, finding information, or binding entities.
  3. Infernal Pact: Spend 1 Demonic Essence to summon a PL2 demon to perform tasks or fight for you temporarily.
  4. Infernal Insight: Spend 1 Demonic Essence and make an Intellect check. On a success, read surface thoughts of a creature within reach range for 1 minute.
  5. Hellfire Blast: Spend 1 Demonic Essence to make a ranged Intellect attack dealing [[2d6]] fire damage. On a success+, regain the essence.
  6. Demonic Speed: Spend 1 Demonic Essence to double your movement speed until your next turn and gain an additional off-action.
  7. Hellborn Rebuke: As a reaction to taking damage, spend 1 Demonic Essence to deal [[3d6]] fire damage to the attacker.
  8. Soulbound Pact: Empower your summoned demon. For each Demonic Essence spent, increase its power level by +2.
  9. Infernal Emissary: Spend 1 Demonic Essence to create a portal to the 9 layers of Ordealis or back to the prime material. The portal lasts until the end of your next turn.
  10. Greater Demonic Ascension: Transform into a greater demon for 1 minute. Gain immunity to conditions and damage. Your attacks deal an extra [[2d6]] Vozian damage. After use, make an Intellect check at disadvantage; on failure, your body and soul are consumed by infernal forces.
Chimeric Monk

The Chimeric Monk walks the path of ultimate understanding, blending traits from myriad sources such as demons, angels, elementals, dragons, and more. Through deep enlightenment, they transcend the limits of a singular form, drawing on the strengths of all life and energies. Each battle or meditation brings new insights, fusing the physical, spiritual, and arcane. They are masters of transformation and adaptation, seeing the world as an interconnected whole. Their journey leads toward the ultimate realization of becoming an avatar of true balance and harmony, embodying the essence of all things.

Unarmed Striker

When you make an unarmed strike (fist, claw, tentacle, etc.) as an action, you may make one additional unarmed strike on your turn.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Demon’s Frenzy: Tap into demonic rage, increasing your attack speed; gain an extra attack when you make an attack action but take [[1d4]] stress damage.
  2. Angelic Grace: As a half-action, take an Angelic Stance. While in this stance, any creature targeting you with an attack must succeed on a Spirit check before they attack or choose not to attack.
  3. Elemental Shift: As a half-action, choose an elemental damage type to become immune to until the end of your next turn.
  4. Dreamsea Step: As a free action once per long rest, slip between the dream world and reality, phasing out of existence until the end of your next turn, avoiding all attacks and preventing conditions.
  5. Nature’s Grace: As a free action, gain advantage on your next check once per short rest.
  6. Dragon’s Roar: As an action, unleash a terrifying roar. Creatures within short range must succeed on a Spirit check or be inflicted with the fear condition.
  7. Construct Endurance: Reinforce your body with the resilience of a construct; gain +10 armor that lasts for 1 hour or until a press on or long rest.
  8. Titan’s Stomp: As an action, slam the ground with the force of a giant, creating shockwaves; knock prone all creatures within short range and deal [[3d6]] impact damage.
  9. Soul Mirror: As a reaction, when you take damage, reflect the damage back at your attacker for the exact amount.
  10. Avatar of True Understanding: Transform into an avatar that embodies the essence of all life forms and energies for 1 minute. While in this state, you gain:
    • Elemental Shielding: Gain 100 armor.
    • Omniscient Clarity: Gain advantage on all checks as you briefly understand all life and the flow of energy around you.
    • Overwhelming Power: Your unarmed attacks deal an additional [[6d6]] damage of a chosen energy type (fire, lightning, radiant, etc.) for the duration.

    Aftermath: After the transformation ends, you take the exhaustion, stunned, and blind conditions for 1 hour as you recover from your avatar state.

Luminary

The Luminary is a living beacon of bioluminescent power and reactive evolution, embodying the raw potential of life itself. Whether inspiring allies with radiant energy, shielding them with adaptive defenses, or disorienting foes with dazzling transformations, the Luminary thrives as a dynamic force on the battlefield. Their ever-changing abilities reflect their connection to the primal forces of nature, adapting to challenges in real-time. Beyond combat, their glowing presence captivates and influences, making them both a formidable protector and an awe-inspiring figure. The Luminary doesn’t just survive—they evolve, illuminating the path for others while reshaping the world around them.

Catalyst Aid

As a half-action, target an ally and give them +3 on their next attack check until the end of their next turn.

Armored Carapace

As a half-action, gain armor equal to your Strength until the end of your next turn.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Spell Point at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Hyper-Reactive: As an off-action, when an ally is attacked, you can use your ranged weapon to make an attack at disadvantage against the attacker.
  2. Catalyst Aid II: When you use Catalyst Aid, you heal the target for [[1d4]].
  3. Spiked Carapace: Creatures that strike you with melee attacks while Armored Carapace is active take [[1d10]] Piercing damage.
  4. Prismatic Halo: As an off-action, during a social interaction, you can shift your skin tone or create a soft color glow to gain advantage on Influence checks until the end of your next turn. Usable once per long rest.
  5. Catalyst Aid III: Allies also deal an additional +3 damage when using Catalyst Aid.
  6. Elastic Limbs: Extend melee attacks to reach range.
  7. Radiant Layering: While Armored Carapace is active, you emit soft light, giving enemies advantage to hit you but granting allies within reach range disadvantage to be hit.
  8. Winged Growths: Gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed for 1 minute, or glide significant distances to jump chasms or gaps without falling damage.
  9. Dual Hearts: You move and recover with greater efficiency, gaining an additional half-action.
  10. Armored Catalyst: You can use Catalyst Aid and Armored Carapace at the same time.
Mentalist

Your cognitive prowess transcends the boundaries of mundane thought, touching the ethereal edges of arcane realms. While some argue that the origin of your abilities is rooted in traditional magic, others see it as a testament to the uncharted territories of the human psyche. With an unwavering will that almost seems to shimmer with its own enchantment, you wield this cerebral power both on the battlefield and off. Your heightened perceptual abilities not only give you an edge in understanding the world but also let you tap into latent energies, often overlooked by others.

Intellect Spellcaster

Your heightened senses allow you to weave magic from the world around you, drawing upon unnoticed energies. You cast spells with your Intellect Check, and you have spell points equal to your Intellect check.

Illusionist

Create an illusion within short range, fooling senses (sight, sound, etc.) for up to 1 minute (extended by 1 minute per additional spell point). If you spend 3 spell points, you can alter perceptions and make real objects that last for 1 hour (extended by 1 hour per additional spell point).

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
  • Gain +1 Spell Point at each of these levels.

Progression Steps

  1. Telekinetic Hands: You always have an invisible hand that can carry objects with 1 or less bulk, use simple objects, open doors, administer potions, or perform similar tasks within short range.
  2. Telepathic Relay: Communicate with creatures you can see within medium range telepathically, if they understand language.
  3. Mental Push: As an action, unleash a wave of psychic energy. Creatures within short range that you choose must make an Intellect check and be pushed back 10 ft, reducing the amount by 5 ft per success.
  4. Mind Reading: Spend 1 spell point as an action to probe a target's mind within short range and gain insight into its thoughts and emotions. The target must make an Observation check, or you learn one piece of information of your choice (e.g., emotional state, recent memory, hidden motive). Spend an additional spell point to try to learn something new; the creature makes another Observation check.
  5. Predictive Defense: Gain +15 armor while awake.
  6. Psychic Wall: As an action, spend 1 spell point to gain 10 armor that lasts until the end of your next turn.
  7. Thought Theft: As an action, spend 1 spell point to recreate an ability you have seen in the last minute. If the ability is a spell, you must spend an equivalent number of spell points.
  8. Cerebral Overload: As an action, spend 3 spell points to incapacitate an enemy by overwhelming their mind. They must make an Intellect check or become stunned until the end of their next turn. Each time you use this ability on a creature, they gain +3 to the check.
  9. Psychic Pain: As an action, touch a creature and cause [[1d4]] psychic damage.
  10. Psychic Ward: As an action, spend 3 spell points to touch a creature and grant them immunity to damage until they take damage or 1 minute passes.
Reaper

A Reaper's strength lies in precision and stealth. If they find themselves in prolonged combat, it's a sign of a mission gone awry. Their expertise is the silent takedown; if a target survives the initial encounter, chaos often ensues. Their mere presence is an omen of impending doom, a whisper of darkness soon to befall.

Stealth

When you get a success+ on a stealth check, gain the invisible condition until the start of your next turn.

Reaper's Breath

If a creature has not seen you, acted in combat, or is unaware of your position, gain [[2d6]] to the attack roll and deal that much additional damage.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).

Progression Steps

  1. Death’s Armor: Summon a shroud of Eclipse armor as a reaction to an attack hitting you, reducing the damage by half.
  2. Precision Strike: You can choose to do a called shot at disadvantage instead of -10.
  3. Reaper’s Awareness: You have a total of 2 off-actions per turn.
  4. Master Manipulator: As a half-action, make an Observation check against a target's Influence. If you succeed, you can manipulate them into revealing a useful piece of information or performing a minor action in your favor.
  5. Soul Siphon: As an off-action, when you make a successful attack on a creature, heal yourself for half the damage dealt.
  6. Wings of the Owl: Manifest ethereal wings that allow for silent, swift movement and evasion. As a half-action, summon spectral wings for silent flight equal to your movement speed.
  7. Harbinger of Zuinmuir: Gain guidance from an angel of death. As an off-action, gain advantage on a check.
  8. Promise of Death: As an action, touch a creature that has died within the last hour and remove the death condition and any permanent loss of wounds.
  9. Touch of Death: You are immune to Eclipse damage and can choose to deal Eclipse damage instead of your weapon’s normal damage.
  10. Zuinmuir’s Scythe: Summon a spectral scythe, a symbol of your grim authority. This scythe deals [[6d6]] Eclipse damage and lasts for 1 minute. After using the scythe, you cannot summon it again for [[1d6]] days.
Runebinder

Runebinders are mystical artisans who have mastered the ancient and arcane art of rune crafting. They are both scholars and warriors, blending intellect with martial prowess. Through their deep understanding of magical runes, they imbue objects with powerful effects, altering the very essence of their gear for both offensive and defensive purposes.

Runic Inscription

You can apply a rune as an action. If the rune requires activation, it takes an off-action and lasts for 1 minute. You can have a number of active runes equal to your Intellect. You start with the ability to make simple +1 runes that give a +1 bonus to what you choose. You can only put one rune on a single piece of gear.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).

Progression Steps

  1. Wind Rune: When activated, this rune grants you or an ally a burst of speed, increasing movement by 20 feet.
  2. Preventing Rune: This inactive rune can be activated as a reaction to prevent a condition.
  3. Shielding Rune: When activated, grants +10 armor.
  4. Exploding Rune: When activated, the rune explodes, dealing [[1d10]] fire damage to creatures within reach range.
  5. Elemental Rune: Changes a weapon's type to an elemental type or grants +3 armor.
  6. Rune of Clarity: Can be activated to grant advantage on the next check.
  7. Enhanced Inscriptions: Your simple runes now add +3.
  8. Healing Rune: Craft a rune that heals [[1d6]] wounds when activated, but it can only be activated once per long rest.
  9. Rune of the Phoenix: Grants +3 to Intellect, Influence, Spirit, and Observation. When the wearer is reduced to 0 wounds, the rune activates, healing [[1d8]] wounds before the injured condition is applied.
  10. Master Runebinder: Gain the ability to inscribe a "Unity Rune" onto your equipment, which combines the effects of two runes into one slot.
Strider

Striders are enigmatic agents of balance, embodying the profound dichotomy of night and day, life and death. They are not mere spies or skirmishers; they are custodians of the equilibrium between light and darkness. In their hands, the powers of solar radiance and eclipse shadows are more than just tools for espionage or combat; they are symbols of the eternal cycle of creation and destruction. Shadow Striders move through the world as avatars of this duality, their actions guided by a deeper understanding of the interconnectedness of all things.

Eclipse Dash

As a half-action in dim light or darkness, teleport a short range.

Solar Flare

As a half-action, target a creature within short range with a burst of light. They must make an Observation check or take the blind condition until the start of their next turn.

Progression

Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:

  • Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).

Progression Steps

  1. New Dawn: (Agility +1, Stealth +1, Spirit +1, Observation +1) As a half-action, touch a creature to transfer a condition from the target to yourself.
  2. Duality Strike: Your melee attacks deal either Eclipse or Solar damage. As a half-action, swap a weapon’s damage type to its normal damage, Eclipse, or Solar.
