Their skin is as coarse and rugged as lava stone, and their eyes glow with an infernal light that strikes fear into the hearts of their foes. They are known for their intimidating presence, often using their terrifying appearance to their advantage in battle. Despite their heavy build, they are capable of short flights, a skill they use to surprise their enemies and gain the upper hand in combat. Their bodies are naturally armored, providing them with a level of protection that few can match. They are a rare and formidable species, feared and respected in equal measure.

Features:

  • Armored Flesh: Gain +5 armor that can be healed or repaired.
  • Flight: You have a fly speed equal to half your movement speed while not wearing heavy armor.
Celestial (Marble)

The Celestial Gargoyles are a symbol of divine power and protection. Their ancestors were chosen by the angels to guard the great temples of the world, a duty they carry out with unwavering dedication. Their skin is as smooth and polished as marble, and their golden eyes and hair shine with a heavenly light. They are capable of sustained flight, a gift bestowed upon them by the angels to aid in their sacred duty. They are also capable of releasing a burst of radiant energy, a manifestation of their divine power that can harm those who threaten the peace of their temples. They are a rare and revered species, seen as a beacon of hope and a symbol of divine protection.

Features:

  • Flight: You have wings that give fly speed equal to your movement or half as much if you are wearing heavy armor.
  • Radiance Burst: As an action, create a burst of radiant energy dealing [[1d4]] Solar damage to all creatures within reach range.
Stone (Greystone)

The Greystone Gargoyles are the embodiment of ancient tradition and natural power. They are the descendants of the original gargoyle bloodline, born from the very stone of the earth. Their skin is as hard and unyielding as granite, and their bodies are built for endurance and strength. Despite their heavy build, they are capable of flight, a skill they use to patrol their territories and protect their kin. They have the unique ability to regenerate their bodies, healing wounds and injuries at a remarkable rate when they remain still. They are a rare and respected species, seen as the guardians of ancient traditions and the protectors of their kind.

Features:

  • Flight: You have wings that give fly speed equal to your movement or half as much if you are wearing heavy armor.
  • Regeneration: As an action, heal for [[1d6]] but you take the pinned condition until the end of your next turn.
Nemuri (Mind Stone)

The Nemuri Gargoyles are a unique and mysterious species, born from the stone of the Nemuri sea. Their bodies glow with a strange luminescence, a reflection of their connection to dreams and memories. They are capable of flight, a skill they use to traverse the Nemuri plane and explore the mysteries of the universe. They are also capable of releasing a burst of radiant energy, a manifestation of their Nemuri power that can harm those who threaten their peace. They are a rare and enigmatic species, seen as the keepers of dreams and the guardians of the Nemuri plane.

Features:

  • Flight: You have wings that give fly speed equal to your movement or half as much if you are wearing heavy armor.
  • Nemuri Dreamweaver: Harnessing your innate connection to the Nemuri plane, you possess the unique ability to delve into the dreams and memories of others. As an action, you can seamlessly enter the dreamscape of a sleeping creature. This power allows for communication, observation, and interaction within their dreams, reflecting your deep integration with the realms of dreams and memory.
  • Memory Echo: You can touch an object and make a Spirit check. On a success, you can see echoes of significant events associated with it. This ability can reveal hidden truths and forgotten pasts.

Beastmen Options

Zoanthropes

Zoanthropes, also known as shifters or half-men, are a unique species of creatures that possess both human and animal traits. They are neither wholly human nor wholly animal, placing them outside of society's norms and conventions. They have the ability to shift between human and animal forms, a skill that sets them apart and makes them both fascinating and feared. Known for their strong connections to the natural world, they possess heightened senses, strength, and agility. While revered by some cultures as protectors of the natural world, they are often ostracized and discriminated against, seen as freaks and outsiders. They frequently form tight-knit communities where they can find acceptance among their own kind.

Predatory Heritage

Predatory Heritage

These shifters possess a strong predatory heritage and are characterized by their sharp claws and powerful jaws. They are skilled hunters, often preying on meat to sustain themselves. Rarely found in cities, they prefer a tribal lifestyle where they can hunt and roam freely. Fierce and powerful, they are often seen as protectors of their tribe.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Predator)

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Sharp Claws: When you attack with an unarmed strike, deal an additional 3 slashing damage.
  • Predatory Shift: You can shift as an Off-Action for 1 minute, tapping into your beast side and deal an additional 1d4 slashing damage with unarmed strikes.
Avian Heritage

Avian Heritage

These half-men have evolved to possess avian characteristics, with the ability to shift into a full bird form. Agile and quick, they can fly and soar with the grace of a bird. Often found near communities of avian beastfolk, they are considered a mutation of the humanoid/lycanthrope. Known for their strong sense of community, they are highly intelligent and adaptable.

Average Size

4-6 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Avian)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Feathered Fall: You don't take fall damage.
  • Avian Shift: You can shift as an Off-Action for 1 minute. While shifted, you have a fly speed of 60 ft if you have no Hefty items.
Cervidae Heritage

Cervidae Heritage

These shifters possess a strong cervidae heritage, characterized by their deer or hooved animal form. Known for their speed and agility, they can outrun and outmaneuver threats with ease. Peaceful and gentle by nature, they are fiercely loyal to their tribe and become formidable when threatened. Often found in wooded areas, they are considered protectors of the forest.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Beast)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Nature’s Grace: Your movements are guided by the forest's flow. Gain advantage on Survival checks made to navigate natural environments, and your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain caused by foliage, mud, or other natural obstacles.
  • Swift Retreat: Take a stance at the end of your turn that remains until the start of your next turn, or until activated. When a creature makes a melee attack against you and misses, you can use your reaction to move up to half your movement without provoking opportunity attacks.
Aquatic Heritage

Aquatic Heritage

These shifters possess a strong aquatic heritage, characterized by their ability to shift into a full aquatic form such as fish or marine mammals. Equipped with powerful fins, gills, and webbed extremities, they excel in underwater environments. With heightened senses underwater and the ability to communicate with aquatic creatures, they are considered protectors of the ocean and its inhabitants. Often found near coastal or aquatic communities, they are known for their peaceful and loyal nature.

Average Size

4-6 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Aquan)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Amphibious: You can breathe in water and on land. You have no disadvantages caused by being underwater and you have a swim speed equal to your movement speed.
  • Tidal Rush: As a half-action, you dash up to your movement speed, creating a wave of water in your path. Creatures within reach of your path must succeed on an Agility check or take 1d4 fluid damage.
Satyr Heritage

Satyr Heritage

The Satyrs are a mystical and mischievous breed of shifters, deeply tied to the feywild and the untamed forces of nature. Often mistaken for beastmen, Satyrs possess a unique blend of humanoid intelligence and feral instinct. With goat-like features such as cloven hooves, small horns, and nimble frames, their true essence lies in their connection to the fey.

Natural performers and instigators, Satyrs thrive in chaos and revelry, wielding haunting melodies and captivating charm to influence others. Despite their playful demeanor, they are fiercely protective of their kin and the wilds they call home. Often found in ancient groves or hidden fey crossings, they act as guardians and emissaries of their enigmatic fey ancestry.

Average Size

4-6 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Aquan)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Jumper: Your jump distance is equal to your movement.
  • Herding Instinct: You have advantage on Influence checks to gather creatures together. You gain +2 loyalty with creatures that travel with you.
  • Goat Song: As a reaction, let out a haunting, melodic bleat and make a Performance check. On a success, it confuses and distracts opponents, giving them disadvantage on a check. Only works once on a creature.
Centaur Heritage

Centaur Heritage

Centaurs are proud and noble shifters, blending the strength of their equine heritage with the sharp wit and determination of their humanoid form. Known as tireless hunters and warriors, they roam the expansive grasslands and plains they call home. Centaur society revolves around freedom and duty, with members acting as both protectors and providers for their community.

In a bitter conflict with the Hellborn Minotaurs over the Thundering Plains, Centaurs view this battle as a fight for the survival of their way of life. Agile and fast, they are unmatched in endurance and maneuverability, revered as guardians of the plains. Skilled artisans and storytellers, Centaurs preserve their rich history through oral tradition and symbolic art, drawing strength from their connection to nature and the open skies.

Average Size

4-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Beast)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Very Rare

Features

  • Trampling Charge: When you move at least 20 ft in a straight line before attacking, you can make a trampling attack. Targets within your path must succeed on an Agility check or take 1d4 Impact damage and be knocked prone.
  • Burdenless Strength: Your lower body is built for carrying. You have double the carrying capacity of a creature of your size, and you can carry one creature of medium size or smaller on your back without reducing your movement speed.
Araknakin

The Araknakin are a type of Beastmen that trace their evolution to multiple origins. Most Araknakin hail from the Red Desert, a homeland for insect-like species that have adapted to its harsh conditions. Among these unique creatures are the Scorpikin.

Scorpikin

Scorpikin

Scorpikin, also known as Aqrabuamelu in their native tongue, are fierce and formidable shifters. Created by the dragon goddess Tiamat to wage war against her rivals, these half-human, half-scorpion beings have since gained independence. Now residing in the Red Desert, they live under the rule of the powerful insect-like Scarab Lords. With their human upper body and scorpion lower half, Scorpikin possess immense strength, agility, and an additional pair of pincers that can hold objects or be used as weapons. Known for their fierce loyalty and combat prowess, Scorpikin are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Insect)

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Uncommon

Features

  • Additional Arms: Pinchers: You have two pairs of arms—one upper humanoid pair and one lower pair of pincers. The pincers can hold simple objects and are considered standard weapons (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical).
  • Toxic Sting: You have a venomous sting at the end of your tail. As a Half-Action, you can make a melee attack with your sting. On a flesh hit, deal 1d4 Toxic damage.
Spiderkin

Spiderkin

Spiderkin are a unique species of humanoids characterized by their lean, thickly haired bodies and large mandibles. Their mandibles make speaking the common tongue difficult, yet they have adapted to communicate effectively. Females of the species are known for their powerful builds and combat abilities, while males are agile and often skilled in magic. Fiercely loyal to their tribes, they are commonly found in wooded or mountainous regions where they spin webs for hunting and protection. Many Spiderkin have found work in libraries, weaving intricate web systems to categorize and organize knowledge.

Male Size

3-5 ft

Female Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Insect)

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Uncommon

Features

  • Spider Climb: You can move on any surface. Moving on walls is considered difficult terrain if you are carrying hefty items.
  • Web Spray: As an action, spray webbing in a 20ft square or line. The webbing creates difficult terrain and lasts for 1 minute.
  • Acidic Bite: You can make a bite attack as an Off-Action, dealing 1d4 acid damage.
Tikkin

Tikkin

Tikkin are a small, elusive species known for their need to survive on blood. With small statures and sharp fangs, they feed on the blood of other creatures. Despite their unique dietary requirements, Tikkin are not inherently violent, often finding non-harmful methods to sustain themselves. However, their nature leads to societal rejection, forcing them to live in the shadows. Fiercely protective of their communities, Tikkin have developed a strong sense of loyalty and care for their own kind. Some have learned to control their blood thirst, while others struggle to overcome their instincts.

Male Size

2-4 ft

Female Size

3-5 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Insect)

Diet

Blood, Fluid

Rarity

Uncommon

Features

  • Parasitic Bite: It takes 1 minute to drain 1 pint (8 oz) of blood from a living creature. You require 1 pint per day to be sustained. Draining more than one pint causes the creature to take the Exhausted condition for 1 hour.
  • Parasitic Sustenance: After drinking a pint of blood, gain 1d6 healing and +1 to checks for 1 hour.
  • Blood Frenzy: After drinking blood, you enter a frenzy for 1 hour, gaining +10 armor.
Avians

Avians are a diverse species of beastmen whose feathered forms and flight abilities connect them to the skies. Adapted to various climates and cultures across the world, they range from proud hawk-like warriors to peaceful dove-like diplomats, each embodying unique avian traits. Their cities, suspended among the clouds or perched atop towering peaks, are marvels of architecture, blending natural beauty with engineering precision. These skybound civilizations are steeped in ancient feathered traditions, including the sacred "Molting Ceremony," where feathers lost in combat or hardship are ritually honored as symbols of resilience.

Avians are natural navigators, known for their ability to traverse great distances with ease, making them revered messengers and scouts. While fiercely protective of their aerial territories, Avians often serve as bridges between grounded civilizations, bringing knowledge, trade, and diplomacy from one land to another. Their language, Naech (or Trill), is a melodic combination of chirps, whistles, and harmonics that echoes their heritage. As guardians of the skies and keepers of the winds, Avians hold their ancient traditions as dearly as they do their freedom, soaring through history as symbols of unity and wisdom.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Trill)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Uncommon

Avian Options

Corvus

Corvus

Corvus are a unique avian subspecies born under the patronage of the gods Huginn and Muninn. Those born under Huginn are intelligent crows, while those under Muninn are ravens cursed by a fey deity with perfect memory, though they can only speak in mimicry if they choose to. This duality of intelligence and memory has led them to thrive in roles as court reporters, spies, and stage performers. Often found in cities, Corvus use their talents to gather information, navigate social hierarchies, and make a living. Skilled in stealth and adept at moving in the dark, they are both enigmatic and resourceful.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Corvus forgo flight completely.
  • Shadow Wings: Your dark feathers allow you to blend into the shadows. Gain advantage on Stealth checks in dim light or darkness. Once per long rest, you can shroud yourself in shadow as a half-action, gaining the invisible condition.
  • Raven’s Insight: You excel at problem-solving and recognizing patterns. Gain advantage on Intellect checks related to puzzles, traps, or decoding messages. Additionally, you can mimic simple sounds or voices you’ve heard. Creatures can make an Intellect check to discern the mimicry.
Crane

Crane

The Crane are a proud and adventurous species, known for their long, slender limbs and formidable fighting skills. They are a nomadic people, constantly wandering in search of new experiences and challenges. Despite their wanderlust, they are fiercely loyal to their families and communities. Their society is organized around small, tight-knit clan groups, each led by a respected elder. These clans periodically gather for grand celebrations to share stories, trade goods, and honor their shared heritage. Cranes are trained in combat from a young age, using their long limbs to strike from unexpected angles and maintain a safe distance from their foes.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Cranes forgo flight completely.
  • Celestial Call: Once per long rest, as an action, let out a resonating cry that inspires allies and unsettles foes. Allies within short range heal for 1d4 and gain +2 to their next check. Enemies in the same range must make a Spirit check or take the Deaf condition until the end of their next turn.
  • Healing Waters: If near a body of water, as an action, heal an ally within short range for 1d6 wounds by channeling the water’s essence.
Hawk

Hawk

The Hawk humanoids, also known as Avian Knights, are a proud and honorable species. Their bodies are covered in feathers, with wings that allow short flights or gliding over long distances. Their sharp talons, combined with their strength and agility, make them exceptional hunters and warriors. Hawks are organized in a feudal system, where each territory has its own lord responsible for the safety and well-being of their people.

The Avian Knights, as the most powerful members of their society, serve as the lord’s personal protectors and military leaders. Known for their bravery, loyalty, and commitment to justice, they dedicate their lives to training and discipline to become the best warriors. Fiercely independent but compassionate, Hawks symbolize hope and are revered as defenders of the weak. Whether in the air or on the ground, they are a force to be reckoned with, embodying the virtues of strength, courage, and nobility.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Hawks forgo flight completely.
  • Talon Strike: Your talons are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; 1 hand, Light; 1d6 Physical). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you may choose to grapple instead of rolling on the success table.
Owl

Owl

The Owl humanoids are a highly respected and influential species, characterized by their large, wise-looking eyes, muted feathers, and sharp talons for hunting. Known for their exceptional intelligence and problem-solving abilities, they are often called upon to serve as mediators, judges, and jurors due to their reputation for impartiality. Owls are also revered as sages and leaders, frequently consulted for their knowledge and insight.

Owl society places wisdom above all else, encouraging individuals to seek knowledge and experiences throughout their lives. They maintain a strong oral tradition, passing down stories of their wise ancestors from generation to generation. Ignorance is seen as a grave threat, and wisdom is viewed as the key to understanding the world. Owl humanoids are natural leaders, trusted decision-makers, and symbols of intellectual achievement within their communities.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Owls forgo flight completely.
  • Keen Vision: Your sharp eyesight allows you to spot details others might miss. Gain advantage on Observation checks related to sight, and you can perceive objects up to twice as far as most creatures in clear conditions.
Passerine

Passerine

The Passerine humanoids, also known as Swift Avians, are small but mighty birds known for their quickness, agility, and bright, colorful feathers. Their small size allows them to maneuver through tight spaces, dense forests, and crowded cities with ease. Adventurous and social, Passerines love exploring new places and meeting new people, making them natural messengers and scouts.

Passerines are known for their sharp memory, able to recall intricate details from their travels. Their communication style includes a complex system of chirps, songs, and body language, making their interactions lively and expressive. Their ability to manipulate air currents with their wings enables them to glide effortlessly, navigate dangerous terrains, and find shortcuts, making them invaluable members of any traveling party.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Passerines forgo flight completely.
  • Territorial Dive: Use the height advantage to make a devastating dive attack. As an action, if you are flying or at a higher elevation, dive down to strike a large or smaller target. The attack deals 1d6 Impact damage and knocks the target prone if they fail a Strength check.
Penguin

Penguin (Aquatic Avians) 🐧

Penguins are a unique subspecies of avian beastmen, adapted to life in cold coastal regions and the open ocean. Though flightless, they are exceptional swimmers and agile divers, capable of navigating icy waters with unmatched grace. Known for their tightly-knit communities, they build intricate ice villages along glacial coasts, fortified against the harsh elements. Penguins hold deep cultural reverence for the "Eternal Ice," an ancient tradition celebrating resilience, teamwork, and the bond between the sea and the sky. These ceremonies involve synchronized dances and storytelling by elder penguins, recounting legendary migrations and ocean spirits.

Penguins have strong protective instincts, working cooperatively to guard their homes from predators and environmental dangers. Their natural resilience and physical adaptations make them excellent aquatic scouts, fierce protectors, and invaluable allies in both the sea and icy terrains. Despite their smaller stature and inability to fly, penguins exemplify determination, resourcefulness, and a profound connection to the ocean's mysteries.

Features

  • Aquatic Adaptation: Penguins are natural swimmers with a swim speed equal to their movement speed. They can hold their breath for up to 1 hour and gain advantage on Survival checks made in cold environments or near water.
  • Communal Instinct: Penguins instinctively protect their allies. When an enemy targets an ally within reach of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll by intercepting or distracting the attacker.
Phoenix

Phoenix

Phoenixes are rare, mystical avians connected to fire and renewal. Known for their blazing feathers and the ability to rise from their ashes, they are symbols of hope and perseverance. Phoenix societies focus on the cycles of life, death, and rebirth, with sacred pyres serving as places of renewal and meditation. Their fiery presence and ability to endure make them a beacon of resilience and inspiration.

Features

  • Avian Flight: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Due to the heavy weight of gear, many Phoenixes forgo flight completely.
  • Rebirth: You have the Fire Avian feature until you take the injured condition. While in the injured condition, you lose the Fire Avian feature and gain the Ashen Avian feature. If you take the death condition, you lose both and enter hibernation for 1d4 weeks. When you awaken, you return to your fire form. This feature cannot be used more than once per year.
  • Fire Avian: You are immune to fire damage and deal an additional 1d4 fire damage on melee attacks and spells.
  • Ashen Avian: Your appearance inspires unease or reverence. As an action, you can spread your wings dramatically and emit a haunting caw. All creatures of your choice within short range must make a Spirit check or take the fear condition.
Beruklians 🐒🦧

Beruklians

Beruklians are a unique and advanced species of ape humanoids that originated from various tropical islands around the world. They have unified on the island of Beruklian, where they have developed a highly organized and hierarchical society. Due to the island's dense population, towering high-rise structures have been constructed to house their vibrant culture. The city is a bustling hub of trade, commerce, and education, with a deep respect for hierarchy and order reflected in every aspect of their society. Even when Beruklians leave the island, they maintain their strong sense of social hierarchy and order, making them a fascinating species to observe.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial

Diet

Vegetarian

Rarity

Uncommon

Beruklian Options

Gorilla

Gorilla

The Gorilla subspecies is a powerful and intimidating force to be reckoned with. Renowned for their immense strength and warrior-like abilities, they are highly sought after in the corporate world. Many major companies employ Gorillas as bouncers and security guards, appreciating their physical prowess, discipline, intelligence, and loyalty. Their presence alone is often enough to deter troublemakers, making them an invaluable asset for businesses seeking top-notch security. Gorillas are not only symbols of power but also of trust and reliability.

Features

  • Powerful: You have advantage on Strength checks.
Mono Grito

Mono Grito

The Mono Grito subspecies, also known as the Howler Monkey subspecies, is known for their loud and piercing screams. Boisterous and outgoing, they thrive in group settings and enjoy being the center of attention. Their highly social nature makes them excellent communicators, and their ability to coordinate as a team is unmatched. Mono Gritos bring an infectious energy and excitement to any environment, making them a lively and colorful addition to any group.

Features

  • Scream: As a reaction to a creature making a melee attack against you, make an Influence check. On a success, the attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. This ability can only be used once per creature.
Oranggian

Oranggian

The Oranggian subspecies is a highly respected and revered group of primates known for their wisdom and teaching abilities. They are often seen as influencers of society, admired for their deep understanding of nature and the world. Many Oranggian possess magical abilities and are skilled druids, capable of communing with the natural world and harnessing its power. Their wisdom and insight are frequently sought by others, making them trusted guides and mentors who help navigate life's complexities.

Features

  • Wise Teacher: When you give the help action, add your Spirit to the assisted check.
Papio (Baboon)

Papio (Baboon)

The Papio subspecies, also known as baboons, are a group of primates known for their intimidating and fierce nature. They are often feared for their aggressive and unpredictable behavior. With their physical strength, powerful jaws, and sharp teeth, they are formidable opponents in any situation. While their wild nature makes them difficult to domesticate or control, Papios are highly intelligent and adaptable, thriving in diverse environments. They also possess a complex social structure and communication system, allowing them to work effectively in groups despite their fearsome reputation.

Features

  • Intimidating Maw: Make an Influence (Intimidation) check against a humanoid creature no larger than twice your height. On a success, the target gains the fear condition.
Caniform 🐺🐻🦊

Caniform

The Caniform humanoids are a diverse group of species, including the Lupine (Alpha), Lupine (Sovereign), Ursakin, and Foxxin subspecies. They are characterized by physical traits resembling canines, such as sharp teeth, strong jaws, and powerful paws. Known for their strength, intelligence, and diverse abilities, Caniforms are a valued and respected part of any society.

The Lupine (Alpha) subspecies are proud and noble leaders, known for their fierce loyalty and exceptional hunting skills. The Lupine (Sovereign) subspecies are regal and majestic, often serving as mediators and diplomats due to their intelligence and strong sense of justice. The Ursakin subspecies are large and sturdy, known for their strength, endurance, and love of nature, despite their intimidating appearance. The Foxxin subspecies are mischievous and cunning, known for their adaptability, quick wit, and charming personalities. Together, these subspecies reflect the diversity and strength of the Caniform species.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Predator)

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Common

Canifom Options

Lupine (Alpha)

Lupine (Alpha)

The Lupine (Alpha) subspecies are proud, fiercely loyal leaders, easily recognized by their striking coats of pure white or jet black—a mark of their lineage, said to descend from Fenris themself. Their heritage ties them to ancient tales of bravery and ferocity, with some Alphas claiming to carry Fenris’s wild spirit within them. Alphas are natural-born leaders, often serving as pack heads, tribal chiefs, or war commanders. While their hot-headed nature can lead to brash decisions, their determination and unwavering loyalty inspire those who follow them.

In the wild, Alphas are exceptional hunters, using their keen senses to track prey and enemies alike. Their booming howls, resonant and commanding, rally their allies and strike fear into foes. Despite their impulsive tendencies, Alphas hold a deep responsibility for their pack’s well-being, often putting themselves at risk to protect their kin. They embody both the strength and flaws of their legendary ancestor.

Features

  • Heightened Senses: Gain advantage on Observation or Survival checks relying on smell or hearing, reflecting their predator instincts.
  • Alpha Dominance: As an action, force an enemy within medium range to make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition.
  • Pack Howl: As a half-action, let out a howl that gives your allies within short range +2 to their next attack check and damage.
Lupine (Sovereign)

Lupine (Sovereign)

Lupine (Sovereign) Caniforms are regal and wise, embodying the harmonious balance between nature and their wolfen heritage. These noble figures serve as spiritual leaders and mediators, guiding their packs with a deep connection to the land and divine forces. Revering Tala, the goddess of nature, they dedicate their lives to expanding her influence and nurturing the wilds. Sovereign territories are lush havens, cultivated through their abilities to summon rain and nurture fertile soil, ensuring abundance for their kin. Known as the “Goodest Guardians,” Sovereigns prioritize justice and stewardship, resolving conflicts with diplomacy before resorting to strength. Their howls carry a sacred resonance, invoking blessings from the forest itself.

Features

  • Heightened Senses: Gain advantage on Observation or Survival checks relying on smell or hearing, reflecting their predator instincts.
  • Fertile Soil: As a 10-minute action, touch or call to plants, causing them to grow quickly and in abundance, providing food and resources.
  • Rain Summoning: Make a Spirit check. On a success, summon rain, providing relief in dry areas and making it difficult for enemies to fight.
Ursakin

Ursakin

The Ursakin are a gentle yet powerful subspecies, embodying the strength and resilience of their bear ancestors. Known for their love of community and simple pleasures, Ursakin villages are nestled in forest clearings or by rivers, where they live in harmony with nature. They are natural builders and protectors, revered for their ability to perform great feats of strength and their calm, thoughtful demeanor. However, when provoked or their kin are threatened, Ursakin become unyielding warriors, using their size and power to defend their homes. Tales often recount heroic Ursakin warriors holding off hordes of enemies or performing impossible feats of endurance. Despite their intimidating presence, Ursakin are kind-hearted and value friendship, often bonding with others over food, stories, and a shared love of nature.

Features

  • Lazy Shrug: Once per day, as an off-action, negate any amount of damage. However, you take the Exhausted condition.
  • Bear Hug: When you grapple a creature, do so with advantage and deal 1d4 Impact damage on a successful check.
Foxxin

Foxxin

The Foxxin are clever and quick-witted, known for their playful nature and boundless adaptability. Found in bustling cities, dense forests, or barren deserts, the Foxxin thrive wherever they roam, blending intelligence with resourcefulness to survive. Often seen as tricksters, they use their sharp minds and natural charm to outmaneuver foes, negotiate favorable deals, or escape sticky situations.

Foxxin society celebrates legendary rogues and cunning heroes, admired for outsmarting stronger opponents. Despite their sly reputation, they possess an innate sense of justice, often working in the shadows to protect the vulnerable. Their laughter-like calls are both a signature and a weapon, unnerving enemies and rallying allies. Valuing wit, charm, and mischief, Foxxin make both entertaining companions and formidable opponents.

Features

  • Heightened Senses: Gain advantage on Observation or Survival checks relying on smell or hearing, reflecting their predator instincts.
  • Faux Paws: You only take 1 damage from stress when pushing on a check.
Coyote

Coyote

The nomadic Coyotes are the wandering storytellers and resilient survivalists of the Caniform species. Often traveling in small groups or as lone adventurers, they are known for their sharp tongues and clever antics. Coyotes thrive in open plains, deserts, and scrublands, where they use their humor and guile to outwit enemies and navigate social conflicts.

Believing in the power of stories to inspire and unite, Coyotes often serve as the historians of their people. Their ability to adapt to harsh conditions makes them skilled scavengers and cunning strategists. While their antics can be chaotic, they are also deeply tied to their trickster roots, bringing laughter and mischief wherever they go. Their Howling Laughter, a mocking and disruptive call, echoes through the wilds, confusing foes and leaving them vulnerable.

Features

  • Heightened Senses: Gain advantage on Observation or Survival checks relying on smell or hearing, reflecting their predator instincts.
  • Howling Laughter: As an action, let out a mocking howl, causing enemies within short range to make an Intellect check or take the Confused condition until the end of their next turn.
Cloven 🐮🦌

Cloven

The Cloven are a proud and reclusive species of humanoid beastmen, characterized by their cloven hooves and shaggy fur. Native to mountainous regions, they live in small, tight-knit communities. Despite their gruff exterior, Cloven are fiercely loyal to their families and will go to great lengths to protect them. They are excellent hunters and trackers, relying on their keen senses and agility to survive in harsh environments.

In combat, Cloven utilize their powerful legs and sharp hooves to devastating effect, often charging into battle with reckless abandon. While generally wary of outsiders, they can be formidable allies to those who earn their trust. The Cloven are a noble species, and encounters with them are rarely forgotten.

Average Size

7-9 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Beast)

Diet

Vegetarian

Rarity

Common

Cloven Options

Caprakin (Goatmen) 🐐

Caprakin (Goatmen)

The Caprakin are hardy and tenacious humanoid beastmen, thriving in steep, rocky landscapes where their agility and balance are unparalleled. Known for their bold nature and fierce independence, they are often found in mountainous regions, grazing on natural grasses and defending their tight-knit communities with vigor. Despite their aloof demeanor, Caprakin hold strong loyalty to their herds and ancestral lands.

Legends of the Caprakin tell of their defiance against invaders, using their mountainous homes as natural fortresses to repel stronger foes. Their haunting war cries echo through the cliffs, instilling fear and awe in those who hear them. Caprakin culture values resilience, storytelling, and a deep connection to the land. Climbing competitions and feats of strength are common rituals, often accompanied by epic tales of their heroes.

Features

  • Unshakable Footing: You are immune to being knocked prone and ignore “rocky” difficult terrain. You can climb rocky or steep terrain as if it were normal ground.
  • Warcry: As an action, let out a chilling war cry. Enemies within short range must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition until the end of their next turn.
Minotaur (Hellhorn)

Minotaur (Hellhorn)

The Hellhorn Minotaurs are a fiery and fearsome subspecies, their blood-red fur and sharp horns reflecting their infernal ancestry. Touched by dark, otherworldly forces, Hellhorns are known for their quick tempers and relentless ferocity in battle. Born on windswept plains, they embrace the thrill of the hunt, pursuing wild game and rival tribes with unmatched determination. While their infernal heritage often casts them in a sinister light, many Hellhorns channel their rage toward protecting their kin or carving out territories to ensure survival.

Hellhorn culture values strength and dominance, with ceremonial duels and displays of power marking their gatherings. Some Hellhorns seek redemption, striving to break free from their dark heritage, while others fully embrace it, using their infernal resilience to dominate enemies and defend their lands.

Features

  • Charging Beast: If you move toward a target within short range, gain advantage on your next melee attack. You must move closer to the target to gain this advantage.
  • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the pinned condition instead of rolling on the success table.
Minotaur (Labyrinthine)

Minotaur (Labyrinthine)

The Labyrinthine Minotaurs are ancient guardians, revered for their unparalleled sense of direction and role as protectors of sacred mazes. Their fur often bears intricate, natural patterns resembling mazes, and their towering frames exude both mystery and wisdom. Originating as wardens of ancient dungeons, they are now invaluable guides in modern cities, where their ability to never lose their way makes them adept navigators and troubleshooters in crowded environments.

Labyrinthine Minotaur culture is steeped in traditions of service and protection, with rites of passage that involve defending or solving labyrinths. To these Minotaurs, mazes are sacred spaces connecting them to their ancestors and their duty. Despite their intimidating presence, Labyrinthine Minotaurs are gentle and patient, earning respect as guides, mediators, and wise protectors.

Features

  • Never Lost: If you are in a location you've been to before and need to make a navigational check, you automatically succeed.
  • Maze Magic: You can cast simple illusion spells to help or hinder creatures in a maze, such as creating an illusion of a wall or projecting a map of the maze.
  • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get
    Cervidae (Deerfolk) 🦌

    Cervidae (Deerfolk)

    Cervidae are elegant and swift Cloven beastmen, known for their connection to the forest and their strong sense of community. With antlers that grow in intricate patterns, they serve as protectors of ancient groves and champions of nature. While they are wise and peaceful, they can become fierce defenders when their homes are threatened.

    Features

    • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the pinned condition instead of rolling on the success table.
    • Forest Stride: Ignore movement penalties from natural terrain, such as dense foliage or mud.
    • Swift Retreat: At the end of your turn, take a stance that remains until the start of your next turn or until activated. When a creature makes a melee attack against you and misses, you can use your reaction to move up to half your movement without provoking opportunity attacks.
    Equinor (Horsefolk) 🐎

    Equinor (Horsefolk)

    Equinor are proud and noble Cloven who embody the spirit of freedom and the open plains. With sleek builds and powerful legs, they are unmatched in endurance and speed, capable of covering great distances without tiring. Their culture revolves around their connection to the land and the stars, often using celestial patterns to chart their travels. Known for their loyalty and unyielding determination, Equinor serve as scouts, messengers, and protectors, weaving tales of their journeys into the fabric of their communities.

    Features

    • Galloping Stride: When you take the Dash action, you can move triple your normal movement speed.
    • Endurance Runner: Gain advantage on Survival checks related to long-distance travel or navigation.
    Bovinus (Bisonfolk) 🐃

    Bovinus (Bisonfolk)

    The Bovinus are massive, bull-like Cloven, known for their unwavering strength and communal bonds. With their thick hides and powerful horns, they are natural defenders of their herds and lands. Bovinus are deeply spiritual, often holding rituals that honor the cycles of nature and their ancestors. Their culture values cooperation and hard work, with communal feasts and storytelling as central aspects of their society. Despite their gentle and calm demeanor, Bovinus are formidable in battle, capable of charging enemies with devastating force.

    Features

    • Charging Beast: If you move toward a target within short range, gain advantage on your next melee attack. You must move closer to the target to gain this advantage.
    • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the pinned condition instead of rolling on the success table.
    • Barkskin: Gain +5 armor, which can be healed or repaired.
Cervidae (Deerfolk) 🦌

Cervidae (Deerfolk)

Cervidae are elegant and swift Cloven beastmen, known for their connection to the forest and their strong sense of community. With antlers that grow in intricate patterns, they serve as protectors of ancient groves and champions of nature. While they are wise and peaceful, they can become fierce defenders when their homes are threatened.

Features

  • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the pinned condition instead of rolling on the success table.
  • Forest Stride: Ignore movement penalties from natural terrain, such as dense foliage or mud.
  • Swift Retreat: At the end of your turn, take a stance that remains until the start of your next turn or until activated. When a creature makes a melee attack against you and misses, you can use your reaction to move up to half your movement without provoking opportunity attacks.
Equinor (Horsefolk) 🐎

Equinor (Horsefolk)

Equinor are proud and noble Cloven who embody the spirit of freedom and the open plains. With sleek builds and powerful legs, they are unmatched in endurance and speed, capable of covering great distances without tiring. Their culture revolves around their connection to the land and the stars, often using celestial patterns to chart their travels. Known for their loyalty and unyielding determination, Equinor serve as scouts, messengers, and protectors, weaving tales of their journeys into the fabric of their communities.

Features

  • Galloping Stride: When you take the Dash action, you can move triple your normal movement speed.
  • Endurance Runner: Gain advantage on Survival checks related to long-distance travel or navigation.
Bovinus (Bisonfolk) 🐃

Bovinus (Bisonfolk)

The Bovinus are massive, bull-like Cloven, known for their unwavering strength and communal bonds. With their thick hides and powerful horns, they are natural defenders of their herds and lands. Bovinus are deeply spiritual, often holding rituals that honor the cycles of nature and their ancestors. Their culture values cooperation and hard work, with communal feasts and storytelling as central aspects of their society. Despite their gentle and calm demeanor, Bovinus are formidable in battle, capable of charging enemies with devastating force.

Features

  • Charging Beast: If you move toward a target within short range, gain advantage on your next melee attack. You must move closer to the target to gain this advantage.
  • Horned Warrior: Your horns are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Piercing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the pinned condition instead of rolling on the success table.
  • Barkskin: Gain +5 armor, which can be healed or repaired.
Felidae 😺

Felidae

The Felidae are a diverse and proud race of feline humanoid creatures found in various regions across the world. Known for their agility, strength, and keen senses, they are skilled hunters and warriors. Felidae have a strong sense of community, often establishing territories where they live and work together in harmony. Their society is deeply rooted in loyalty and kinship, with every member contributing to the wellbeing of the whole.

Physical Characteristics

Felidae typically stand between 4-7 ft tall, with slender, muscular bodies and a wide range of fur colors and patterns, including stripes, spots, and solid colors. Their faces resemble those of large cats, with pointed ears, sharp teeth, and distinctive whiskers. They have large, expressive eyes, well-adapted for low-light vision, and their overall appearance exudes both grace and strength.

Culture

Felidae culture is steeped in tradition and a deep connection with the natural world. They have a profound respect for nature's balance and often live in harmony with their surroundings. Skilled hunters and trackers, they rely on their innate abilities to stalk and catch prey. Additionally, Felidae have a strong affinity for music and storytelling, with folklore passed down through generations in the form of songs and tales.

Social Structure

Felidae society is divided into close-knit communities called prides, usually led by a dominant individual or a small group of leaders. These prides consist of families and friends who work together to protect their territory and meet the group's needs. Felidae are fiercely loyal to their pride and will go to great lengths to defend it from external threats.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Predator)

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Common

Felidae Options

Paka (Cat-Folk)

Paka (Swahili for Cat)

Living primarily in the coastal regions around the Vozian Sea, the Paka are masterful sailors, traders, and artisans. Their maritime culture thrives on exploration, trade, and craftsmanship, with their ships doubling as floating galleries of intricate carvings and vibrant colors. Once rulers of ancient kingdoms, the Paka now live in communities shaped by the remnants of their lost empires, blending nostalgia with resilience. Despite the loss of their lands to the Ostrio Empire, the Paka remain resourceful, using their sharp wits and social acumen to thrive in a competitive world.

Choose one:

Paka Pilot

Paka pilots are skilled helms people and navigators with a deep understanding of navigating in most territories and piloting animals or vehicles.

  • Vehicle Expertise: Gain advantage on any checks related to navigation, riding, or piloting.

Paka Trader

Paka Traders are experts in negotiation and bartering, using their natural charm and wit to secure the best deals for themselves and their communities.

  • Silver Tongue: +1 to Influence, and gain advantage on Influence (Bartering) checks when trading goods or services.
Shujaa (Lion-Folk)

Shujaa (Swahili for Lion)

The Shujaa are proud and powerful warriors whose lives revolve around honor, strength, and a deeply ingrained hierarchy. Centered around the contested City of Salt, their ongoing battle with the Scarab Lords has forged a warrior culture steeped in discipline and courage. The Shujaa value martial prowess above all else, with their greatest leaders revered as living legends. Despite their fierce exterior, Shujaa society is built on unity and mutual respect, as even the mightiest warrior must protect the pride.

Choose one:

Shujaa Warlord

Shujaa Warlords are the mightiest of their kind, leading their fellow warriors into battle with unwavering resolve and unmatched tactical prowess.

  • Battlefield Commander: As a half-action, give a simple command to an ally within short range. The ally moves their turn in initiative order to immediately after yours.

Shujaa Guardian

Shujaa Guardians are the protectors of their people, defending their territory and loved ones with unyielding determination and skill.

  • Protector's Instinct: As a reaction, when an ally within melee range is targeted by an attack, you can reduce the attacker's roll by -3.
Kivuli (Panthari)

Kivuli (Panthari)

The Kivuli, or Panthari, are enigmatic and elusive Felidae, often called the "Shadows of the Jungle." Living in dense forests or hidden enclaves, they are masters of stealth and ambush tactics. Their black or darkly patterned fur allows them to blend seamlessly with their surroundings, making them nearly invisible in low light. Kivuli culture revolves around safeguarding ancient knowledge and defending sacred jungle sites. While they prefer to remain unseen, their swift and precise strikes leave an unforgettable mark on those who threaten their home.

Their society values cunning over brute strength, with elders teaching younger generations the art of patience, observation, and precision. Kivuli legends speak of "Night Stalkers," legendary warriors who once protected entire regions with unmatched stealth and agility.

Features

  • Jungle Stalker: Gain advantage on Stealth checks in natural environments. On success+ Stealth checks, gain the invisible condition until the end of your next turn.
  • Charging Beast: If you move toward a target within short range, gain advantage on your next melee attack. You must move closer to a target to gain this advantage.
Cheetari (Mwendokasi) 🐆

Cheetari (Mwendokasi)

The Mwendokasi, or Cheetari, are the fastest of all Felidae, known for their unmatched speed and agility. Found in open savannahs or expansive grasslands, their slim, muscular builds allow them to outrun nearly any predator—or prey. Mwendokasi are revered as messengers, scouts, and first responders in times of conflict, carrying vital information across vast distances.

Their culture celebrates swiftness as both a survival tool and a spiritual connection to the wind. Ritual foot races and endurance trials are key traditions, showcasing their speed as an offering to the spirits of the plains. Legends tell of Nyayo za Upepo (Steps of the Wind), Mwendokasi who could run so fast they seemed to disappear entirely, leaving only a trail of wind behind them.

Features

  • Burst of Speed: As an off-action, double your movement speed until the end of this turn.
Half Cloven

Half Cloven

Half Cloven are a group of large, herbivorous humanoid creatures that share traits with various grazing animals. Known for their impressive size, strength, and unique abilities, they are generally peaceful but can become fearsome opponents when needed. Despite their imposing appearance, Half Cloven possess a charm and gentle demeanor that endears them to many.

Physical Characteristics

Half Cloven are large and imposing, standing between 6-10 ft tall. Their bodies are a blend of humanoid and animal features, with strong, muscular limbs and thick skin. Each option has unique traits, such as the Hippokin's hippopotamus-like features, the Elephantine's elephantine traits, and the Roxodon's rhinoceros-like appearance.

Culture

Half Cloven culture is centered around community, cooperation, and harmony with nature. They often live in small, tight-knit groups, working together to ensure the safety and well-being of all members. Their connection to the land makes them natural protectors of their territories and resources.

Social Structure

Half Cloven communities are usually led by a council of elders, respected for their wisdom and experience. Decisions are made collectively, giving each member a voice in matters that concern them. Family bonds and friendships are deeply important, and they go to great lengths to support and protect their loved ones.

Average Size

7-9 ft

Lifespan

200-400 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Predator)

Diet

Herbivore

Rarity

Common

Half-Cloven Options

Hippokin 🦛

Hippokin

The Hippokin are contemplative and wise, resembling humanoid hippopotamuses. Known for their love of rivers and marshlands, they are natural swimmers and builders, often constructing homes along waterways. Hippokin are revered for their intellect and ingenuity, focusing on crafting, invention, and the exchange of ideas. Their communities serve as hubs for trade and knowledge, enriching their regions with innovation.

Hippokin take pride in their calm and measured demeanor, often acting as mediators and problem-solvers. However, when roused to action, their immense strength and nearly impenetrable hide make them formidable opponents. Hippokin warriors are known for using water as a tactical advantage, drawing enemies into terrain they control.

Features

  • Impenetrable Hide: Gain an additional +5 armor that can be healed or repaired.
  • River's Resilience: When you are submerged in water, gain advantage on Physical checks. Additionally, you can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.
Elephantine 🐘

Elephantine

The Elephantine are gentle giants, deeply rooted in tradition and community. Resembling humanoid elephants, they are renowned for their exceptional memories, which they use to preserve history, culture, and craftsmanship. Elephantine communities are often led by matriarchs or councils of elders, guiding their people with wisdom and compassion.

Deeply connected to the land, the Elephantine act as stewards of the environment and protectors of sacred sites. Their trunk, a versatile and powerful appendage, symbolizes their adaptability and strength. Elephantine artisans are famed for creating tools, art, and architecture that blend functionality with beauty.

Features

  • Impenetrable Hide: Gain an additional +5 armor that can be healed or repaired.
  • Trunk Mastery: Your trunk functions as a versatile tool. You can use it to interact with objects, grapple creatures, or make an unarmed attack as an off-action that deals 1d6 Impact damage.
Roxodon 🦏

Roxodon

The Roxodon are stoic and formidable, resembling humanoid rhinoceroses. Known for their incredible strength and resilience, they are natural protectors, often serving as guardians of their communities and territories. With rough, armor-like skin and massive horns, they are nearly impervious to physical harm, and their sheer presence can deter most threats.

Roxodon society values endurance and discipline, emphasizing physical training and martial skill. Their culture is one of balance: fierce in defense of their kin but equally compassionate and generous. Roxodon warriors are celebrated for charging into battle, using their horns to scatter enemies and break through defenses.

Features

  • Impenetrable Hide: Gain an additional +5 armor that can be healed or repaired.
  • Rhino Charge: As an action, charge a target within short range but beyond reach if you have the movement to reach them. Make a Strength check, and on a success, deal damage equal to your check as Impact damage and knock the target prone if they fail a Strength saving throw.
Camelon (Camelfolk) 🐪

Camelon (Camelfolk)

The Camelon are Half Cloven adapted to arid environments, with features resembling humanoid camels. Known for their resilience and resourcefulness, they endure extreme conditions and traverse vast deserts with ease. Camelon culture revolves around water conservation, trade, and nomadic traditions, often serving as guides and merchants in harsh terrains.

Features

  • Desert Resilience: You require only half the normal amount of water and food to survive. Additionally, you are immune to any elemental damage once per long rest.
Gliers

Gliers

The Gliers are small, swift, and resourceful beastmen who embody boundless energy and unrelenting curiosity. These diminutive humanoids are as diverse in appearance as they are in culture, with each option drawing unique traits from the small mammals they resemble. Gliers thrive on their quick wits, nimble movements, and a natural talent for adapting to their surroundings. Though often underestimated due to their size, their ingenuity and industrious nature have earned them a place in nearly every corner of the world.

Gliers’ communities reflect their individualistic yet cooperative spirit. While some prefer the safety of forests, rivers, or burrows, others wander endlessly, drawn by the thrill of discovery. Their quick speech and fast-paced lives often leave larger creatures struggling to keep up. Yet, for all their restlessness, Gliers form deep bonds with those they trust, standing by their allies with fierce loyalty. Whether crafting gadgets, hoarding treasures, or exploring unknown lands, the Gliers bring vibrancy and cleverness to all they touch.

Average Size

3-5 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Beast)

Diet

Herbivore

Rarity

Rare

Gliers Options

Leporidae (Rabbikin)

Leporidae (Rabbikin)

The Leporidae have a dark past. For a long time, both the Leporidae and halflings were hunted due to a rumor that the feet of these creatures provided a luck bonus. This history shifted the nature of the Leporidae, and they now stick to the underground as much as possible. Despite this, Leporidae remain humble and happy travelers, seeking friendship and love wherever they go.

Features

  • Lucky Paw: You can use a Luck check for any checks that require your hands.
  • Lucky Foot: Once per long rest, when you fail a check, you can reroll it and take the new result.
Opossum

Opossum

Opossums are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid opossums. Known for their love of shiny objects and their ability to hang from trees with their prehensile tails, they often become merchants or collectors of unusual and valuable items.

Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Opossums have slender, flexible bodies covered in grayish-white fur, long rat-like tails for climbing and hanging, pointed snouts, small ears, and beady eyes. They build their homes in trees or burrows, and their communities are often found in forested areas. Fascinated by shiny and unusual objects, Opossums trade and collect items with other races, leveraging their cunning and resourcefulness.

Features

  • Play Dead: Can appear dead under weak inspection for up to 8 hours.
  • Tuff Tail: Your tail is considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Physical; Impact). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to cause the prone condition instead of rolling on the success table.
Raccoon

Raccoon

Raccoons are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid raccoons. They are inventive and intelligent creatures, often creating gadgets and trinkets or collaborating with other races to design and build traps.

Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Raccoons have stocky bodies covered in grayish-brown fur with distinctive black markings around their eyes. They have dexterous, human-like hands with sharp claws, bushy ringed tails, pointed snouts, small ears, and dark eyes. Known for their creativity and ingenuity, Raccoon communities focus on crafting and problem-solving, often working together to invent useful devices. Sociable and curious, they bond easily with others who share their passion for discovery and invention.

Features

  • Nimble Fingers: Gain advantage on checks to pick locks, disable traps, or steal objects unnoticed.
  • Tinker’s Mind: Once per long rest, create a simple gadget or tool (e.g., a basic trap, lockpick, or noise-making device) using found materials.
Squirrel

Squirrel

Squirrels are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid squirrels. Energetic and agile, they have a strong desire to explore and travel, although their attachment to food hoards often keeps them close to home.

Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Squirrels have slender bodies covered in reddish-brown fur, large bushy tails, sharp claws for climbing, round expressive eyes, and small tufted ears. Their communities are usually found in forested areas, with homes built in trees or burrows. Adventurous and curious, they protect their food hoards fiercely and form close bonds with those who share their love of exploration and adventure.

Features

  • Squirrel Paws: Can climb on any natural surfaces.
  • Pack Rat: Has more in their pack than they realize, doubling carrying capacity.
Beaver

Beaver

Beavers are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid beavers. They are hardworking and industrious creatures, renowned for their skill in construction and engineering.

Standing between 4-5 ft tall, Beavers have stocky bodies covered in thick, waterproof fur in shades of brown. They are easily identified by their large, flat tails and powerful front teeth capable of cutting through wood with ease. Beavers also have small, rounded ears and dark eyes.

Beaver communities are often found near rivers and lakes, where they construct elaborate dams and lodges using their natural engineering talents. Highly organized and efficient, they work together to build impressive structures that provide safety and comfort for their families. Beavers have a strong sense of community and cooperation, often working alongside other races on large-scale construction projects.

Features

  • Siege Damage: Deal additional damage to structures and determine weak points in walls or foundations with an Intellect Check.
  • Bite: Your teeth are powerful and useful. Make a bite attack as an off-action, dealing 1d4 Piercing damage.
Platypus

Platypus

Platypuses are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid platypuses. They are enigmatic and peculiar creatures, possessing a unique set of abilities that set them apart from other Gliers.

Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Platypuses have streamlined bodies covered in waterproof fur in shades of brown. Their flat, duck-like bills and webbed feet make them excellent swimmers, while their small, rounded ears and dark eyes give them a curious and alert appearance.

Platypus communities are typically found near rivers and lakes, where they build their homes in burrows along the banks. Solitary and mysterious, they rarely interact with other races. Platypuses have a strong connection to the natural world, using their electrolocation abilities to navigate aquatic environments and find food. Resourceful and adaptable, they thrive in a variety of situations.

Features

  • Balanced Tail: Gain +3 to checks requiring balance.
  • Hidden Stinger: Make an unarmed strike against flesh that deals an additional 1d4 Poison damage.
Porcupine (Quillkin) 🦔

Porcupine (Quillkin)

The Quillkin are defensive specialists, resembling humanoid porcupines. Covered in sharp quills, they are tough and resilient, known for their ability to ward off predators with their natural defenses.

Solitary and cautious, Quillkin prefer to avoid conflict but are formidable opponents when cornered. Their sharp quills make them highly effective at deterring attackers and ensuring their survival in the wild.

Features

  • Quill Defense: When an enemy hits you with a melee attack, deal half their damage back to them as Piercing damage.
Chippoterian (Bat Folk)

Chippoterian (Bat Folk)

Chippoterian, also known as bat folk, are a diverse species known for their ability to fly. Though not avian, they possess traits of various bat species such as vampire bats, fruit bats, and even deformed-nosed varieties. Their wings and keen senses make them excellent rangers and spies. Highly adaptable, they can survive in most environments, particularly dark and damp areas. Known for their stealth and dark vision, Chippoterian are fiercely loyal to their tribes and thrive in close-knit communities.

Features

  • Bat Flight: Has a fly speed equal to movement when wearing light armor or less. Heavy gear makes flight impossible, leading many to forgo flight completely.
  • Echo: As an off-action, emit a high-pitched sound to sense targets within 120 ft if not obstructed or behind cover.
  • Blind Fighting: Immune to the blind condition.
Molefolk (Diggers) 🦡

Molefolk (Diggers)

Molefolk are subterranean Gliers with strong, clawed hands designed for digging. Thriving underground, they excavate vast tunnel systems for their homes and communities. Resourceful and resilient, Molefolk are perfectly adapted to life in dark and confined spaces.

Features

  • Burrower: You have a burrowing speed of half your movement, allowing you to move through loose soil or soft dirt.
  • Blind Fighting: Immune to the blind condition.
Pangolin

Pangolin

The Pangolin are enigmatic and protective humanoids with scaled armor and retractable claws. Often acting as guardians of natural reserves, they are defenders of endangered ecosystems. Their ability to curl into a ball makes them nearly impervious to harm.

Pangolin communities are highly secretive, living in remote, forested regions. Seen as keepers of ancient natural wisdom, their scales are often inscribed with symbols representing the cycles of life and nature.

Features

  • Iron Curl: As an off-action, curl into a ball to double your armor, but you take the constrained condition.
Armadillo

Armadillo

Armadillo beastmen are sturdy and adaptable, with armored shells that provide natural protection. Known for their ability to curl into a ball and roll at high speeds, they often serve as scouts or messengers in challenging terrain.

Armadillo communities are highly mobile, often traveling in caravans across deserts and grasslands. They value adaptability and resourcefulness, with a knack for finding creative solutions to problems.

Features

  • Rolling Charge: As an action, curl into a ball and roll up to half your movement in a straight line, dealing 1d6 Impact damage to all creatures in your path and knocking them prone if they fail an Agility check.
Reptilia 🦎

Reptilia

Reptilia, also known as the cold-blooded scale boys, are a diverse group of reptilian humanoids with a wide range of physical appearances and abilities. They are an ancient and resilient race, able to adapt and survive in a variety of environments.

Physical Characteristics

Reptilia typically stand between 5-7 ft tall, with bodies covered in tough, scaly skin that comes in a variety of colors and patterns. They have elongated, lizard-like heads with sharp teeth and slit-like eyes. Some Reptilia have tails, while others possess frills, crests, or spines along their bodies. Their limbs are strong and muscular, with clawed fingers and toes.

Culture

Reptilia communities are often found in warm climates such as deserts, jungles, and swamps, where they bask in the sun to regulate their body temperatures. They have a strong connection to the natural world and are skilled hunters and foragers. While often stoic and reserved, they form strong bonds with others and are fiercely loyal to their families and communities.

Average Size

5-7 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial, Naech (Beast)

Diet

Varied

Rarity

Rare

Reptilia Options

Savra (Lizard-Greek)

Savra (Lizard-Greek)

The Savra are a proud and resilient race of lizard-like humanoids. Their belief in their ancient origins gives them a sense of entitlement and nobility, regardless of their social standing. They often exhibit regal behavior and have an air of sophistication about them. Their scales come in a variety of colors and patterns, and their bodies are lean and muscular.

The Savra are known for their remarkable ability to recover from conditions in half the time, making them formidable adversaries and reliable allies.

Features

  • Regeneration: As an action, remove a non-major condition.
She-Ren (Snake Men-Chinese)

She-Ren (Snake Men-Chinese)

The She-Ren are a race of snake-like humanoids who see the human form as something that can always be improved. Their bodies are a blend of human and snake features, with some individuals having snake-like lower halves they use to constrict enemies. They often adorn themselves with jewelry, tattoos, and undergo magical or mechanical augmentations to enhance their abilities. Known for their venomous bites or powerful constriction abilities, She-Ren are both dangerous foes and valued allies.

Choose One:

Constrictor

The constrictors are strong combatants who can hold their enemies until they submit—or worse.

  • Grappler: Have advantage on grappling checks. When you have a creature grappled, you can deal 1d4 Impact damage as an off-action.
Venomous

The venomous breed are cunning and deadly, with a poisonous bite that leaves combatants mortally wounded.

  • Deadly Bite: As an action, make a bite attack that deals 1d4 Piercing damage and an additional 1d4 Toxic damage on flesh.
Rua (Turtle-Vietnamese)

Rua (Turtle-Vietnamese)

The wise and nomadic Rua are humanoid turtles that seek to protect those around them. Known for their great wisdom and courage, the Rua are exemplified by the legendary Hanoi, who stopped a war by taking a powerful magic sword from a tyrant. Rua have large, hard shells that provide them with natural protection, and they can use their shells as a "Shell of Holding" for storage or as additional armor that regenerates during a long rest. Seen as gentle protectors, Rua are fiercely loyal to their allies.

Features

  • Shell Armor: Gain +10 armor that can be healed or repaired.
  • Shell of Holding: Hold double the amount of carrying capacity in your shell.
Crokagator

Crokagator

The Crokagator are a race of large, powerful lizardmen that inhabit swamps and lakes. They are the undisputed rulers of stagnant pools of water, fiercely defending their territory with tight-knit tribes. Known for their thick, muscular bodies covered in rough scales and their devastatingly powerful jaws, Crokagators are fearsome warriors and formidable defenders of their domain.

Crokagators possess unique abilities that make them terrifying in combat. Their deep bellow can instill fear in their enemies, while their signature "deathroll" attack delivers massive Impact damage to pinned foes. These traits, combined with their ferocious nature, make them both dangerous foes and invaluable allies in battle.

Features

  • Bellow: As an action, make a deep bellow. Creatures in combat with you must make a Mental check. On a failure, they take the Fear condition.
  • Deathroll: If you have a creature grappled, you can use an off-action to deal 1d4 Impact damage by rolling them around.
Marsupials

Marsupials

Marsupials are a diverse and resilient group of beastmen known for their unique adaptations and connection to the land. Recognized by their marsupial pouches, they represent a balance of strength, agility, and practicality. Their societies are often close-knit and community-driven, reflecting their instinct to care for and protect their young. Marsupials are commonly found in regions with arid plains, dense forests, or underground burrows, where their natural skills and adaptations allow them to thrive.

Marsupial cultures emphasize hard work, loyalty, and survival in harsh environments. From the nomadic Kangarans to the steadfast Wombarn, these beastmen embody a deep respect for the natural world and the cycles of life. Their lore is filled with stories of survival, ingenuity, and familial bonds, serving as a testament to their enduring spirit.

Marsupial Options

Kangarans (Kangaroo Folk) 🦘

Kangarans (Kangaroo Folk)

Kangarans are powerful and agile humanoids, resembling kangaroos. Known for their incredible jumping abilities and strong legs, they thrive in open plains and arid landscapes. Kangarans are nomadic by nature, traveling in small groups and following seasonal changes to find resources. They are fiercely protective of their kin and are renowned for their prowess in combat, using their legs to deliver devastating kicks.

Kangaran communities value independence and self-reliance but come together in times of need. They often engage in ritualized combat as a way of resolving disputes or determining leadership, a tradition deeply rooted in their warrior culture.

Features

  • Bounding Strike: You can jump half your movement as part of a melee attack, dealing an additional 1d4 Impact damage and knocking the target prone if they fail a Strength check.
Wombarn (Wombat Folk) 🦔

Wombarn (Wombat Folk)

Wombarn are stout and determined humanoids resembling wombats. Known for their incredible digging abilities and sturdy frames, they are natural builders and defenders. Their burrow-like homes are marvels of engineering, designed to withstand predators and environmental hazards.

Wombarn culture values hard work and practicality, with a focus on creating lasting structures and strong defenses. They are famously stubborn and can be immovable when their minds are set.

Features

  • Burrower: You have a burrowing speed of half your movement, allowing you to move through loose soil or soft dirt. Additionally, you can use an action to create difficult terrain in a reach-range area by digging.
Mythic Beasts

Mythic Beasts

Mythic Beasts are extraordinary beastfolk inspired by legendary creatures from global folklore and mythology. These beings are revered as symbols of power, wisdom, or fear, embodying the traits of the creatures that inspired them.

Mythical beast options

Kirin (Chimeric Deer/Dragon)

Kirin (Chimeric Deer/Dragon)

Origin: East Asian mythology (China, Japan, Korea).
Resembling a deer with dragon-like scales and a flowing mane, the Kirin is a sacred creature associated with peace and prosperity. Beastfolk inspired by the Kirin could serve as spiritual guides or guardians of harmony.

Features

  • Divine Step: Ignore difficult terrain and leave a trail of glowing grass or flowers where you walk.
  • Celestial Presence: Creatures you choose within short range have disadvantage on Spirit checks.
Ammit (Chimeric Lion/Crocodile)

Ammit (Chimeric Lion/Crocodile)

Origin: Egyptian mythology.
The soul-devouring Ammit, a mix of lion, crocodile, and hippopotamus, could inspire a ferocious beastfolk species that enforces laws or acts as fearsome guardians.

Features

  • Soul Rend: When you reduce a creature to 0 wounds, gain temporary Spell points equal to your Spirit.
  • Terrifying Roar: Once per Press On, let out a roar that forces enemies in short range to make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition.
Jackalope (Horned Rabbit)

Jackalope (Horned Rabbit)

Origin: North American folklore.
Jackalope beastfolk could be cunning tricksters, blending the agility of rabbits with the mysticism of antlered creatures.

Features

  • Bounding Strike: You can jump half your movement as part of a melee attack, dealing an additional 1d4 Piercing damage and giving the creature the pinned condition unless they succeed on an Agility check.
Griffin (Lion/Eagle)

Griffin (Lion/Eagle)

Origin: Ancient Greek and Persian mythology.
Griffin beastfolk could represent aerial warriors or protectors of sacred treasures. Their hybrid forms give them unique abilities for both ground and air combat.

Features

  • Powerful Flight: You have a fly speed equal to half your movement.
  • Talon Strike: Your talons are considered a Hefty Weapon (Str; 2 hand, Hefty; Damage equal to Strength—Slashing). Additionally, if you attack as an action and get a success+, you can choose to grapple instead of rolling on the success table.
Tarasque (Behemoth)

Tarasque (Behemoth)

Origin: French folklore.
A massive, dragon-like creature with impenetrable scales, Tarasque beastfolk could be defenders of their homes, combining brute strength with unshakable defense.

Features

  • Immovable Stance: When you take the Dodge action, gain immunity to all physical damage until the start of your next turn.

Trinity of PLague

The Trinity of Plague—Gnolls, Scourge, and Vulturkin—are feared and reviled creatures born from the god Yeeshnu. Seen as harbingers of disease and destruction, their presence is met with hostility in most societies. Playing as these creatures would be exceptionally challenging in campaigns not centered around plague themes due to their stigma, the diseases they carry, and their alignment with a god of death and decay.

Trinity of Plague

Trinity of Plague

The Trinity of Plague is a powerful and feared force in the world, born from the god Yeeshnu. This alliance of Gnolls, Scourge, and Vulturkin represents the embodiment of plague and destruction, united in their worship of their deity. While each species is formidable on its own, together they form an unstoppable force of strength, cunning, and mysticism.

The gnolls are fierce warriors, known for their immense strength and ferocity in battle. The scourge are numerous and cunning, using their vast numbers to overwhelm enemies. The vulturkin, on the other hand, are powerful mystics, able to wield and control the very essence of the plague itself. This trinity often leads cults of plague-worshippers, granting them boons in exchange for their devotion to Yeeshnu.
