Members of the Trinity are outcasts in civilized lands, often killed on sight due to the diseases they carry and the fear they inspire. Playing as a member of the Trinity is a unique challenge, as their presence will be met with caution and distrust, even from allies.

PLagued ones Options

Gnolls

Gnolls

Gnolls are a powerful and imposing species, born from the hyena lord Yeeshnu. Known for their brute strength and ferocity in battle, gnolls often lead bands of Scourge and Vulturkin, using their physical dominance to intimidate and control. Fiercely loyal to their clans, gnolls have a strong pack mentality and will fiercely defend their kin and territory.

Gnolls are carnivorous, known to hunt and devour their prey whole. Their intimidating presence and unyielding loyalty to their god Yeeshnu make them both fearsome enemies and controversial allies.

Average Size

6-8 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Gnollish

Diet

Carnivore

Rarity

Rare

Features

  • Plague Immunity: Immune to all diseases and plagues.
  • Pack Tactics: As an off-action, give advantage to an ally within reach range of the same enemy as you.
  • Rending Claws: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 slashing damage.
The Scourge

The Scourge

The Scourge are a numerous and elusive species, born from the horned rat Yeeshnu. Renowned for their intelligence and cunning, they are often found infiltrating and manipulating other societies to achieve their goals. Omnivorous by nature, they will eat almost anything but show a preference for meat. The Scourge maintain a highly organized society ruled by the powerful Council of Nine, a leadership body that directs their collective actions.

Average Size

3-4 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial (Gutter)

Diet

Omnivore

Rarity

Rare

Features

  • Plague Immunity: Immune to all diseases and plagues.
  • Tunnel Sense: As an action, detect hidden passages and tunnels within short range.
  • Vermin Empathy: You can communicate with small vermin (rats, mice, etc.) and command them to perform simple tasks like spying or retrieving small objects.
Scavengers (Vulturkin)

Scavengers (Vulturkin)

Also known as the Sky Plague, the Scavengers are mystic beings born from the plague. They are deeply connected to death and the afterlife, often serving as spiritual leaders and guides for their fellow Gnolls and Scourge. Known for their elaborate burial rituals and ceremonies, they maintain a strong sense of community and tradition.

Scavengers are carrion eaters, relying on their powerful beaks and talons to strip flesh from carcasses. Despite their ominous reputation, they are valued for their spiritual insights and their ability to commune with the spirits of the dead.

Average Size

7-9 ft

Lifespan

60-90 years

Language

Imperial (Gutter), Naech (Trill)

Diet

Carrion

Rarity

Rare

Features

  • Plague Immunity: Immune to all diseases and plagues.
  • Mystic Sight: As an action, see spirits and invisible creatures within short range on a Spirit check.
  • Able Looter: When looting the dead, make a Luck check to find one more item.

Additional Character Information

Physical Attributes

Size

Size in the world of adventuring isn't merely a matter of height and weight; it's a key factor in determining how a creature interacts with its environment and other beings. From the tiniest insect skittering unseen beneath a leaf to the towering giants striding across mountain ranges, size affects reach, stealth, strength, and vulnerability. A creature's size can determine the spaces it can traverse, the opponents it can challenge, and the impact of its presence in any given situation. In a realm of magic and might, understanding size is crucial for survival and success.

Tiny

Below 1 ft – Examples: Insects, small birds, coins, potion bottles.

Small

1-4 ft – Examples: Cats, small dogs, scroll cases, books.

Medium

5-7 ft – Examples: Humans, elves, armor sets, single weapons.

Large

8-15 ft – Examples: Ogres, bears, large shields, small boats.

Giant

15-25 ft – Examples: Elephants, siege towers, large trees.

Monolithic

25-100 ft – Examples: Large statues, grand castles, airships.

Environmental

100-300 ft – Examples: Mountains, massive ancient trees, celestial landmarks.

Gender

In the realm of Shek, gender is as varied as the landscapes that stretch from soaring peaks to deep mystical forests. Here, identity is not just male or female but also includes the enigmatic dragon. Dragons, with their ancient magic, can fluidly shift to align with the souls of those they cherish. The changelings too, with their transformative abilities, are not bound by any single form. In Shek, it's a gentle reminder for all: never assume, for identity is a personal journey, unique as the being who walks its path.

Motivations

Character motivation refers to the driving force behind a character's actions and decisions in a story. Roll a d100 to choose a motivation or select one from the list below.

Your motivation will appear here.

Additinal Equipment

You'll need this where you are going. Roll 2d20 to choose additional equipment or pick from the list below.

Your equipment will appear here.

Trinkets

A trinket is something that doesn't define your character but adds to their backstory or creates an interesting idea about who they might be. Roll a d100 to choose a trinket or pick from the list below.

Your trinket will appear here.

Additional Equipment

Roll 2d20 to choose additional equipment or choose from the list from below

  1. A bandolier of shotgun shells, a gun cleaning kit, a holster for quick draw
  2. Brewing equipment, a selection of rare herbs and magical ingredients, a few bottles of 'moonshine'
  3. A book of abyssal texts, a set of writing tools and ink, a small collection of scrolls and manuscripts, and a silver holy symbol
  4. Collection jars (for the leeches), a medical kit (with basic supplies)
  5. A broken porcelain mask affixed to your face, a set of manacles (for apprehending the guilty), and a locked spellbook (which you still hold dear)
  6. A grappling hook (for scaling trees and buildings), a water-skin (for emergency fire suppression), and a small first-aid kit (for treating burns and injuries)
  7. A ledger (for keeping track of finances), a set of fine writing implements (for drafting contracts and letters), and a collection of valuable coins (from various nations and time periods)
  8. A portable taco-making kit, a book on taco divination, a collection of exotic taco ingredients
  9. A set of cheese-making tools, a selection of fine cheeses, a guide to cheese varieties, an intelligent cheese
  10. A set of keys to the library, a lantern with a small supply of oil, a set of cleaning supplies, and a small collection of arcane tomes
  11. A set of tattooing tools (needles, inks, etc.), a sketchbook (for designing tattoos), and a few magical inks with unique properties
  12. A set of torture tools, a manual on painless interrogation techniques, a government badge
  13. A set of wooden stakes (for dispatching strigoi foes), a vial of holy water (for use against fiends and other malevolent entities), and a guide to supernatural creatures (detailing their weaknesses and vulnerabilities)
  14. A shoe-making kit, a selection of magical leathers and materials, a catalog of shoe designs
  15. A small pouch of magical components (used for casting spells), a spellbook (containing your first spells), and a scroll case (for storing important documents)
  16. A sturdy belt with multiple pouches for carrying small items, a canvas bag for carrying larger items, and a small pocket knife
  17. A tool kit with magical and mundane tools, a manual on supernatural handyman tasks, a set of keys to various dimensions
  18. A whetstone (for sharpening your weapon), a set of weapon maintenance tools, and a training manual (with notes from your past instructors)
  19. Acrobat's tools (juggling pins, tightrope, etc.), a small makeup kit (for touch-ups before performances), and a set of costume props (for disguising yourself)
  20. Amulet of your divinity, a divine shard, a broken crown of fallen stars
  21. Animal Handling tools (leash, muzzle, etc.), a portable cage (for temporarily holding creatures), and a collection of treats (to gain the trust of animals)
  22. Bedroll (for sleeping during long journeys), a map of the region, and a signal whistle (for alerting fellow guards)
  23. Brewing equipment, a selection of rare herbs and magical ingredients, a few bottles of 'moonshine'
  24. Collection jars (for the leeches), a medical kit (with basic supplies)
  25. Dentist's tools, vampire teeth molds, a book on vampire dental anatomy
  26. Elemental gemstones (used as a focus for channeling elemental energies), a collection of scrolls (detailing various elemental spells and rituals), and a small, elemental creature (such as a salamander, water weird, or stone elemental) bound to your service
  27. Enchanted makeup kit, mirror, small case of various potions
  28. Golem maintenance kit (includes oils, runes, and miniature tools), a manual on golem anatomy, and a golem making kit for a PL [[1d4]] golem takes 6 hours of crafting
  29. Gunsmith tools, a few spectral bullets, an old diary with spectral firearm designs
  30. Handcuffs (engraved with your initials), a notepad and a magnifying glass (in a leather case)
  31. Healer's kit (containing various herbs and bandages), a wooden staff (used for walking and channeling healing magic), and a collection of potions (for various ailments)
  32. Light Hammer (with a handle wrapped in soft leather for a better grip), Flask filled with liquor, and a lighter
  33. Mechanics' tools (a set of wrenches, pliers, and other essentials), a portable workshop (for on-the-go repairs and inventions), and a few spare parts (gears, springs, and other components for quick fixes)
  34. Musical instrument (with intricate carvings) or set of juggling balls (made of fine materials), Performer’s Flourish (+1 Influence)
  35. Old miner's helmet (with functioning lantern), a collection of precious stones
  36. Pocket watch, a city map, a book on city architecture
  37. Recipe book (for different sodas), a portable soda dispenser
  38. Rope, grappling hook, and lockpicks (in a compact pouch)
  39. Ruined Spellbook (pages made from the bark of a magical tree), magical focus (a crystal pulsating with elemental energy), and a pouch of magical reagents (gathered from the wild)
  40. Scale (for weighing and measuring goods), a ledger (for keeping track of inventory and profits), and a set of merchant's tools (for crafting and repairing items), Additional 50 gp
  41. Several bottles of milk (for customer deliveries and emergency sustenance), a large canvas sack (for carrying dairy products)
  42. Thieves' Tools (concealed in a hidden wrist compartment), a grappling hook (collapsible for easy storage), and a set of lockpicks (disguised as cufflinks)
All Trinkets

Roll a d100 to choose a trinket or choose from the list from below

  1. Shotgun shell that was once shot at you, kept as a lucky charm
  2. A broken practice weapon, a reminder of your past failures and determination to improve
  3. A tarnished, silver badge that once belonged to a criminal you captured
  4. A pocket watch with a cryptic inscription on the back
  5. A coin from the organization you once worked for, stamped with a mysterious emblem
  6. A broken amulet, once a symbol of your divine authority
  7. A taco charm, said to bring good luck
  8. A small, enchanted vial containing your former essence
  9. A small, intricately carved figurine of your original form, a reminder of where you came from
  10. A small token of protection, given to you by a friend before your exile
  11. A small, silver medallion bearing the symbol of your order, a constant reminder of your sworn duty
  12. A small, enchanted crystal that changes color and emits faint elemental energy, a gift from your elemental master
  13. A small, ornate box containing a mysterious, abyssal artifact
  14. A dried flower from a rare and dangerous plant you once grew
  15. A spent bullet casing from the first spirit you ever bound to a weapon
  16. A favorite soda spoon, slightly bent but still useful
  17. A small, intricately carved bone used to mix your inks
  18. A miniature shoe charm, said to bring good luck to its owner
  19. A small, perfectly aged cheese that seems to have a personality of its own
  20. An old miner's whistle, said to ward off evil spirits
  21. An old railroad spike, a reminder of your first day on the job
  22. A tiny, perfectly articulated golem hand, a memento from a successful repair job
  23. A small doll, a reminder of your desire to change
  24. A leech preserved in a small glass vial
  25. A mysterious key with an emblem of an unknown organization
  26. A small, unmarked box that contains an unknown substance
  27. A playing card with an ever-shifting face
  28. A small, intricately carved figurine of a mythical creature that you once cared for
  29. A lucky coin, said to bring fortune to those who carry it
  30. A small charm in the shape of your favorite animal from the menagerie
  31. A poster from one of your most memorable performances
  32. A small, worn carving of a caravan, a gift from a grateful merchant
  33. A broken chain, a symbol of your newfound freedom from the arena
  34. A golden pocket watch, engraved with your family's crest, a symbol of your past success and a reminder of the fortune you seek to regain
  35. A small, intricate clockwork contraption you built as a testament to your skill
  36. A small vial of "holy water" that's actually infused with dark energy
  37. A small, carved wooden ship you found among the cargo
  38. A cowbell, a memento from your favorite dairy cow
  39. A badge from your old fire department, bearing the symbol of a phoenix rising from the ashes
  40. A small, worn key that once opened the door to your old guardhouse
  41. A recipe for a particularly potent brew, passed down through generations
  42. A small stone from the foundation of the city's oldest building
  43. A set of vampire fangs you've replaced
  44. A screw from a piece of celestial machinery
  45. An old makeup case containing a mysterious magical substance
  46. A small, enchanted stone that emits a faint, eerie glow
  47. A glass orb that glows slightly when held, no known origin
  48. A small, mechanical bird that occasionally chirps, despite lacking visible power sources
  49. A book with blank pages that sometimes display faint writing
  50. A stone that is always warm to the touch
  51. A wooden puzzle box that has never been opened
  52. A mirror shard that shows a mysterious shadow in the reflection
  53. An old compass that points to something other than magnetic north
  54. A handkerchief embroidered with an unfamiliar coat of arms
  55. A piece of driftwood shaped like a sea creature
  56. A candle that cannot be lit, it emits a faint, sweet smell when warm
  57. A deck of cards where all the kings are missing
  58. A bell that makes no sound when rung
  59. A diary written in an unknown language
  60. A set of old locksmith tools with one pick inexplicably bent
  61. A whistle that only animals can hear
  62. A locket that refuses to open, sounds like something is moving inside
  63. A piece of chalk that writes on air
  64. A feather that falls like a stone when dropped
  65. A glove that absorbs light, making the hand invisible when worn
  66. A bottle of ink that changes color daily
  67. A monocle that shows an arcane symbol when looking at the moon
  68. A scarf that cannot get wet
  69. A comb that makes hair stand on end when used
  70. A matchbox with matches that light when snapped
  71. A pebble that skips on dry land
  72. A coin that always lands on its edge
  73. A key that gets colder as it gets closer to locks
  74. A nail that never rusts
  75. A tooth from an unknown beast, it vibrates slightly in thunderstorms
  76. A map with a place that no one can find
  77. A hat that always returns to its owner when lost
  78. A small box that hums a melody at night
  79. A painting of a door that seems to change in detail
  80. A soap that never lathers
  81. A button that detaches and reattaches itself from clothes
  82. A quill that only writes in rhymes
  83. A pair of glasses that show constellations at night
  84. A bookmark that prevents the book from ever finishing
  85. A flask that doubles the taste of any liquid inside
  86. A lantern with a flame that flickers in the presence of spirits
  87. A spoon that makes any meal taste delicious
  88. A pair of boots that leave footprints of a different creature
  89. A whistle that only works at sunrise and sunset
  90. A ring that feels heavier with lies
  91. A bottle that refills with sea water
  92. A glove that softly glows in the presence of magic
  93. A brush that paints only in shades of blue
  94. A belt that always fits the wearer perfectly
  95. A scarf that smells like the forest after rain
  96. A yarn ball that never tangles
  97. A small statue that slowly turns towards the nearest gold
  98. A pen that writes on its own when left alone
  99. A coin that jumps slightly when near treasure
  100. A feather that acts as a magnet for paper
